title: On Cloud, admin error also leads to branch error
author: jrieke
summary: Users deploying from GitHub repositories without admin permissions on Streamlit Community Cloud encounter a misleading error stating the branch doesn't exist alongside the expected permission error. This occurs because the system likely fails to access the repo to verify the branch. The goal is to suppress the incorrect branch error and only display the relevant admin permission error to improve clarity.

title: Integer/pixel size for `gap` parameter in `st.container` and `st.columns`
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.container, feature:st.columns
summary: The `gap` parameter in `st.container` and `st.columns` currently only accepts restricted string values like 'small', 'medium', or 'large'. This limits design flexibility when precise spacing is needed. The request is to allow integer inputs for `gap` to define specific pixel sizes, providing developers with finer control over layout spacing similar to other width or height parameters.

title: Add an option to fully disable sidebar rendering until authentication or page load is complete
author: andrejunior201
summary: Streamlit currently renders the sidebar and navigation before backend logic executes, causing a 'flicker' or security issue where unauthenticated users can briefly see or click navigation links. This premature rendering creates UX inconsistencies and potential security loopholes for apps with custom authentication. The proposed solution is to add a configuration option, such as `st.set_page_config(show_sidebar_on_load=False)`, to delay sidebar rendering until explicitly allowed by the script.

title: Streamlit blog DNS error
author: manchunyu
summary: The Streamlit blog at https://blog.streamlit.io/ is currently inaccessible due to a DNS error. Users are reporting this downtime which has persisted for a few days. This issue tracks the outage so it can be resolved to restore access to the blog.

title: st.login against MSAL returns authlib OAuthError AADSTS900144: "The request body must contain the following parameter 'client_id'"
author: skruehoetl
summary: Users attempting to authenticate against an enterprise MSAL tenant using `st.login` are encountering an `authlib` OAuthError. The specific error `AADSTS900144` indicates that the `client_id` parameter is missing from the request body during the token exchange. This bug prevents successful login, resulting in a 500 Internal Server Error, despite the authentication process appearing to initiate correctly.

title: AI-assisted `st.date_input`
author: jrieke
summary: This feature request proposes adding an AI-assisted text input field to `st.date_input`. Users could describe a date range in natural language, such as 'from the first to the last day of Q2 in 2023,' and an LLM would interpret this to select the appropriate dates automatically. This enhancement aims to make date selection more intuitive and efficient compared to manual picking.

title: AI-assisted chart builder
author: jrieke
summary: This request suggests integrating an AI-assisted chart builder where users can describe the desired chart in natural language via a text input. The system would then generate a Vega or Plotly specification using an LLM to render the chart. This would likely sit on top of a UI-based chart builder, providing an easier way to create complex visualizations.

title: AI-generated summary/help text in `st.exception`
author: jrieke
summary: Currently, `st.exception` allows users to open exceptions in ChatGPT externally. This proposal suggests integrating LLM capabilities directly into the app to automatically generate and display a summary or helpful advice for exceptions. This would streamline debugging by providing immediate insights within the app interface.

title: Make `st.audio` use the same waveform UI as `st.audio_input`
author: jrieke
summary: `st.audio` currently relies on the standard browser HTML audio player, which lacks the visual appeal of the waveform UI used by `st.audio_input`. The goal is to unify the design by updating `st.audio` to use the same waveform visualization. This update must maintain existing functionality such as playback speed control, volume settings, and download options.

title: Markdown rendering empty triple-backtick code fence adds the string "undefined"
author: DrShushen
summary: When rendering an empty triple-backtick code fence in Markdown, Streamlit incorrectly displays the string 'undefined' inside the code block instead of showing an empty grey rectangle. This is a regression from previous behavior where empty code blocks were rendered correctly. The issue affects `st.markdown` when provided with a code block containing no content.

title: Support real-time chart updates without rerunning the entire script
author: jouinisayf
summary: Updating charts in Streamlit currently triggers a full script rerun, which is inefficient for high-frequency data like IoT sensors or financial feeds. The request is to introduce a mechanism for partial UI updates, such as a `.update()` method on chart objects or a context manager. This would allow specific components to refresh with new data without re-executing the entire script.

title: Add `st.iframe` command
author: jrieke
summary: The proposal is to add a top-level `st.iframe` command to the Streamlit namespace, promoting it from `st.components.v1.iframe`. This change aligns with the move towards custom components v2 and improves discoverability. Additionally, it aims to address limitations in the existing v1 iframe component, such as issues with rendering PDFs.

title: Launch by module - redux!
author: aebrahim
summary: The user requests the ability to launch Streamlit apps by specifying a Python module (e.g., `streamlit run my.module`) instead of a file path. This is particularly useful for build systems like Pants where the final file path might not be known. The feature could act similarly to `python -m`, resolving the module to its file path internally.

title: Container: width value "content" is not working
author: Gubarev
summary: Despite documentation stating that `st.container` supports `width='content'`, using this value raises a `StreamlitInvalidWidthError`. The error message incorrectly asserts that width must be an integer or 'stretch'. This bug prevents users from creating containers that size themselves according to their content as intended in version 1.51.0.

title: Copy to clipboard button not visible in st.code
author: alex-bork
labels: type:bug, good first issue, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.code
summary: In `st.code` blocks containing long lines of text, the content overlaps with the 'copy to clipboard' button, rendering it invisible or inaccessible. This layout issue prevents users from easily copying code snippets when horizontal scrolling is involved or content extends to the right edge. The UI needs adjustment to ensure the copy button remains visible.

title: The configuration of config.toml is inconsistent with localhost and 0.0.0.0
author: Kilig947
summary: There is an inconsistency in how Streamlit applies `config.toml` settings (specifically margins and font sizes) when accessing the app via `localhost` versus `0.0.0.0`. While styles render correctly on `localhost`, they fail to apply when the app is viewed through the IP address `0.0.0.0`, despite being the same running instance.

title: Update design of dropdown menus to align with top nav
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.dataframe, feature:app-menu, feature:st.selectbox, feature:st.time_input, feature:st.multiselect
summary: The design of existing dropdown menus (e.g., `st.selectbox`) is inconsistent with the newer style introduced for top navigation page sections. The goal is to update all dropdown components to match this modern aesthetic. This involves standardizing the look and feel across widgets like `st.selectbox` and `st.multiselect`.

title: Add border around dropdowns in dark mode
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.dataframe, feature:app-menu, feature:st.selectbox, feature:st.date_input, feature:st.time_input, feature:st.multiselect, feature:st.popover, feature:st.color_picker
summary: Dropdown menus in dark mode currently lack sufficient contrast against the background because shadows are less effective in dark themes. The proposed solution is to add a small border around dropdowns specifically in dark mode to improve visibility and accessibility. This change should apply to widgets like `st.selectbox` and `st.date_input`.

title: Turn `st.Page` into a proper class
author: jrieke
summary: Currently, `st.Page` is a function that returns a `StreamlitPage` object rather than being a class itself, which causes confusion for users and in documentation. The proposal is to refactor `st.Page` into a proper class to align the API structure with user expectations and improve clarity.

title: Avoid converting arrow arrays to pandas and then back to arrow in `convert_anything_to_arrow_bytes`
author: mkleinbort-wl
summary: When passing data (like Polars DataFrames) to custom components, Streamlit currently converts the data to Pandas and then to Arrow, which creates unnecessary performance overhead. The request is to optimize `convert_anything_to_arrow_bytes` to handle `pl.DataFrame` or `pa.Table` directly without the intermediate Pandas conversion. This would improve performance and support a more vendor-neutral data handling approach.

title: Drag & drop with st.file_uploader not working
author: sebcwill
summary: Users are reporting that the drag-and-drop functionality for `st.file_uploader` is broken in recent versions. When dragging a file onto the uploader widget, the file is not recognized, and no error message is displayed. This forces users to manually browse for files, degrading the user experience.

title: Multiple elements with `width="stretch"` should have same width
author: jrieke
summary: Currently, when multiple elements with `width='stretch'` are placed in a horizontal container, they do not share the space equally; instead, remaining space is distributed added to their natural width. This leads to inconsistent element sizes. The suggestion is to ensure all 'stretch' elements take up equal width for a more consistent and predictable layout.

title: Support min_width in flex containers
author: sfc-gh-cserrano
summary: A feature request to add a `min_width` parameter to flex containers (like `st.container`). This would allow developers to set a minimum width for containers, ensuring that content remains visible and formatting stays intact when using flexible layouts, particularly preventing elements from becoming too narrow.

title: Number input, decimal numbers issue
author: madhukarjadhav736
summary: There is a bug in `st.number_input` where typing decimal numbers is interrupted. Specifically, when a user types '1.0', the input automatically converts it to '1', preventing the entry of decimals like '1.03'. This behavior makes it impossible to enter certain float values manually.

title: widget values not updating if key is specified
author: rhelouREV
summary: In version 1.50, widgets with a specified `key` ignore the `value` parameter during re-initialization if it differs from the stored session state, unlike in previous versions. This breaks patterns where widgets update based on other interactions without explicit session state callbacks. The user suggests adding an 'allow override' parameter or reverting to the previous behavior.

title: Support text highlighting in st.pdf
author: asaini
summary: Users are requesting the ability to highlight text within the `st.pdf` viewer component. This feature would allow for better referencing of content within PDFs or reflecting actions taken elsewhere in the app (e.g., search results). It aims to make the PDF viewer more interactive and useful for document review workflows.

title: 508 Compliance - Add Alt="" tag to decorative elements
author: dessig-ia
summary: To improve accessibility and meet Section 508 compliance, decorative elements in Streamlit widgets (like the down arrow in selectboxes) need empty `alt=''` tags. Currently, these elements lack alt tags, causing screen readers to announce them, which creates clutter for visually impaired users. Adding these tags will allow screen readers to properly ignore purely decorative graphics.

title: Allow resizing `st.text_area` when height=”stretch”
author: sfc-gh-lwilby
summary: When `st.text_area` is configured with `height='stretch'`, the manual resize handle in the corner is disabled or ineffective. Users want the ability to manually resize the text area even when it is set to stretch to fill its container. This restriction limits user control over the input field's size in flexible layouts.

title: `st.exception` lacks responsiveness at small widths
author: sfc-gh-lwilby
summary: The `st.exception` component has layout issues when rendered at small widths, causing the action links (like 'Search on Stack Overflow') to overflow their container. The suggestion is to make the component responsive by stacking the links vertically when horizontal space is limited. This would ensure the error display remains readable in narrow columns.

title: `st.text_area` jumps back to content height from resized height when user types again.
author: sfc-gh-lwilby
summary: If a user manually resizes an `st.text_area` that is set to `height='content'`, typing in the box causes it to snap back to its auto-calculated content height. This behavior overrides the user's manual resizing preference, leading to a jarring experience. The expected behavior is for the manual size to persist during subsequent typing interactions.

title: Incorrect error message for width
author: sfc-gh-lwilby
summary: Providing a 0 or negative value for a width parameter triggers an error message that is confusing or grammatically incorrect. The issue requests improving the error message to clearly state that the value must be a *positive* integer. This is a minor usability improvement for developer feedback.

title: Fullscreen menu partially hidden in fixed height containers.
author: sfc-gh-lwilby
labels: type:bug, feature:st.dataframe, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.vega_lite_chart, feature:st.map, feature:st.container, feature:st.image
summary: Interactive elements (like dataframes) placed inside fixed-height containers have their toolbar menus cut off if they appear near the container's edge. The overflow is hidden by the container's boundaries, making the option buttons inaccessible. The menu should ideally break out of the container or render in a way that ensures visibility.

title: Display empty expanders based on user controlled parameter
author: okapiadmin
summary: Recent updates changed `st.expander` to render even when empty, whereas previously they were hidden. The user requests a `display_empty` parameter to allow developers to suppress rendering of empty expanders. This is useful for dynamic layouts where expander content might be conditional.

title: `st.expander` fails to display `st.pdf` when initialized in a collapsed state
author: loioladev
summary: A bug exists where `st.pdf` content fails to render if placed inside an `st.expander` that is initially collapsed (`expanded=False`). When the user expands the container, the PDF viewer is missing. It works correctly if the expander is initially expanded.

title: st.segmented control unnecessarily wraps
author: kmcgrady
summary: The `st.segmented_control` component sometimes wraps its options to new lines unnecessarily, even when there appears to be sufficient width. This behavior seems inconsistent and may be related to overly restrictive width constraints in the layout logic. The issue leads to poor visual alignment and wasted vertical space.

title: rotate pages in st.pdf()
author: MustafaKiwaPI
summary: Users request the ability to rotate PDF pages within the `st.pdf` viewer. This could be implemented via a parameter like `st.pdf(rotate=90)` to set an initial rotation. This feature would improve readability for documents with landscape orientation or improper scanning.

title: Add st.container to hover at the specified position (height-width) of its parent component
author: lix8886
summary: The user is asking for absolute positioning or 'floating' capabilities for `st.container`, allowing a container to hover at a specified coordinate relative to its parent. This would enable overlay UIs, floating action buttons, or complex layouts that break the standard flow.

title: Add `Copy to clipboard` for `st.dataframe` and `st.table`
author: ghilesmeddour
summary: Users frequently need to copy data from `st.dataframe` or `st.table`. The request is to add a built-in 'Copy to clipboard' button to the dataframe toolbar, similar to the feature in `st.code`. This would streamline the workflow of exporting data to other tools like Excel.

title: DateColumn (st.column_config.DateColumn) always defaults to mm/dd/yyyy when text editing.
author: jofalck
summary: In `st.data_editor`, when a user double-clicks a `DateColumn` to edit it, the format defaults to `mm/dd/yyyy` regardless of the `format` parameter configured. This inconsistency between display format and edit format is confusing. The edit mode should respect the configured date format.

title: Prevent updates of disabled inputs in `AppTest`
author: michue-work
summary: The `AppTest` framework currently allows tests to programmatically update the value of disabled widgets, which is impossible in the actual app UI. This can lead to false positives where tests pass despite logic errors. The request is to make `AppTest` raise an error or warning when attempting to modify a disabled element.

title: SelectboxColumn and MultiselectColumn should have the same arguments as their respective standalone widgets
author: itsToggle
summary: There is a parity gap between standalone widgets and their Column Config counterparts in `st.data_editor`. `SelectboxColumn` is missing `accept_new_options`, while `MultiselectColumn` is missing `max_selections`. The request is to unify the arguments to ensure consistent functionality.

title: Display full precision of all decimals in st.dataframe() instead of default 4 decimal limit
author: LazerLars
summary: `st.dataframe` defaults to rounding numeric values to 4 decimal places, hiding the full precision unless the cell is edited. Users often need to see the exact values without manual interaction. The request is to allow an option to display the raw, unrounded values by default.

title: Audio files in static serving on Community Cloud require prepending `/~/+`
author: chigkim
summary: Serving static audio files from the `static` folder works locally but fails or requires complex path workarounds on Streamlit Community Cloud. Users want a consistent way to reference and play static audio files across development and deployment environments.

title: Add rounding to `st.video` and `st.map`
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.pydeck_chart, feature:st.map, feature:theming, feature:st.video
summary: To improve visual consistency, this issue proposes adding corner rounding (border-radius) to `st.video` and `st.map` elements, matching the style of other Streamlit widgets. This should utilize the theme's default radii settings, while ensuring controls are not clipped.

title: Use theme colors in `st.map` and `st.pydeck_chart`
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.pydeck_chart, feature:st.map, feature:theming
summary: Currently, `st.map` uses hardcoded colors and `st.pydeck_chart` uses default PyDeck colors, which may clash with a user's custom theme. The proposal is to update these components to utilize the app's theme colors. This would ensure maps and charts blend seamlessly with the rest of the application's design.

title: Improve line gap for colored background text with custom fonts/font sizes
author: jrieke
summary: When using Markdown with colored backgrounds, certain combinations of custom fonts and sizes result in zero gap between lines of text. This creates a cluttered visual appearance. The goal is to ensure a minimum line gap exists to maintain readability and visual separation.

title: Make sidebar border react to hover events
author: jrieke
summary: When the sidebar border is permanently enabled (`showSidebarBorder=True`), it lacks visual feedback on hover to indicate it can be resized. The suggestion is to add a hover effect (e.g., darkening the border) to make the resize functionality more discoverable.

title: On hover, the border for `st.segmented_control` changes color
author: jrieke
summary: A visual bug in `st.segmented_control` causes the left border of a segment to change color on hover, distinguishing it from other borders. This is likely due to overlapping transparency effects. The expected behavior is for all borders to remain uniform in color during hover states.

title: Improve text color on top of light primary colors
author: jrieke
summary: Text placed on top of primary-colored elements (like primary buttons) currently defaults to white, which causes readability issues if the primary color is light. The proposed solution is to automatically switch text color to black or white based on the brightness of the primary color.

title: Fragments are awesome but must to be more: Selective Rerun and Execution Control
author: vquilon
summary: The user proposes two enhancements for `st.fragment`: programmable selective reruns and execution control. First, enabling `st.rerun(scope=['fragment_key'])` to trigger specific fragments. Second, adding a parameter to prevent fragments from re-executing during a full app rerun if their inputs haven't changed.

title: `st.navigation` can be more than just a navigation bar
author: lix8886
summary: This feature request suggests enhancing `st.navigation` by adding dynamic page selection and external link support. Specifically, the user wants to change the selected page programmatically and allow `url_path` to link to external URLs, making the navigation component more interactive and versatile.

title: Support Python 3.14
author: jrieke
summary: Python 3.14 has been released, and Streamlit needs to add official support for it. This involves testing and ensuring compatibility with the new Python version. Updating dependencies and CI pipelines will likely be required.

title: Key is ignored when using fragments and containers
author: arkpope
summary: A bug occurs when adding a component to a global `st.container` from within an `st.fragment`. Despite providing a static `key`, clicking a button inside the fragment appends a duplicate component instead of updating the existing one. This suggests that key uniqueness or state management is failing across the fragment boundary.

title: session_state store list type data errors
author: zoushuhang0
summary: A user reports an error when modifying a list stored in `st.session_state` directly within a loop. This likely causes issues with Streamlit's state tracking or mutation detection. A workaround involves using a temporary variable, but the direct mutation failing is seen as a bug.

title: Custom components as containers
author: jrieke
summary: This feature request proposes allowing custom components to act as containers that can hold standard Streamlit elements. This would enable developers to create custom wrappers, layouts, or UI cards that enclose native widgets. Currently, custom components are leaf nodes.

title: Long dialog starts at the bottom
author: alex-bork
summary: When an `st.dialog` contains enough content to require a vertical scrollbar, it opens scrolled to the bottom by default. This forces the user to manually scroll up to see the beginning of the content. The expected behavior is for dialogs to open scrolled to the top.

title: st.date_input: calendar UI not localized (month/day names remain English) and no locale parameter
author: tjazevedo
summary: The calendar picker in `st.date_input` does not localize month and day names, even if the browser locale is non-English. Users requested a way to localize the calendar UI, either by automatically respecting the browser locale or by adding an explicit `locale` parameter.

title: Support built-in color names for the `color` parameter of charts
author: jrieke
summary: Streamlit's built-in chart elements (`st.line_chart`, etc.) do not currently support Streamlit's semantic color names (e.g., 'red', 'primary'). Users want to be able to use these named colors for consistency with other elements like badges and markdown. This would simplify styling.

title: Add max_size parameter to each st.file_uploader to restrict file size before upload
author: urlan
summary: Currently, file size limits are global via `config.toml`. The request is to add a `max_size` parameter to `st.file_uploader` to enforce limits at the individual widget level. This would save bandwidth and improve UX by preventing large uploads before they start.

title: Dataframes with width="content" are not resizable.
author: sfc-gh-lwilby
summary: In version 1.51.0, setting `width='content'` on an `st.dataframe` disables the ability to manually resize the dataframe in the UI. This is identified as a regression. Users expect to retain the drag-handle for resizing even when the initial width is determined by content.

title: Support modern CSS color formats (consistently)
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Support for modern CSS color formats (e.g., space-separated RGB) is inconsistent across Streamlit. Some areas like chart colors accept it, while `primaryColor` configuration raises parsing errors. The goal is to standardize color parsing to accept modern CSS syntax everywhere.

title: Configure Connection Error in the Streamlit UI
author: devagya-devansh-discovery
summary: When the client loses connection to the server, Streamlit displays a default 'Connection error' message. Users want the ability to configure or customize this message to better suit their application's context or language. This would likely involve a configuration setting.

title: Top navigation makes `st.logo` shrink
author: jrieke
summary: There is a visual inconsistency where the logo displayed via `st.logo` is rendered significantly smaller when top navigation is active (`position='top'`) compared to sidebar navigation. Users expect the logo to maintain a consistent, legible size regardless of the navigation layout.

title: preview  docx file
author: zoushuhang0
summary: A user is requesting functionality similar to `st.pdf` but for previewing Microsoft Word (.docx) files directly within the app. Currently, there is no native widget to render or preview Word documents.

title: help text in st.button not shown on mobile browser
author: wrb2012
summary: The `help` tooltip on `st.button` is not accessible on mobile browsers. On desktop, hovering reveals the text, but on mobile, long-pressing does not trigger the tooltip display. This makes help context unavailable for mobile users.

title: Align items in `st.pills` and `st.segmented_control` horizontally
author: BenDavis71
summary: `st.pills` and `st.segmented_control` fail to respect horizontal alignment settings when their items wrap to a new line. While a single row aligns correctly, wrapped content forces the entire widget to left-align. This breaks the visual layout for centered containers.

title: Make `st.multiselect` not wrap the selected options / keep its height
author: jrieke
summary: Selecting multiple items in `st.multiselect` causes the widget to expand vertically as chips wrap to new lines. This dynamic resizing can break layouts. The request is for an option (e.g., `wrap=False`) to keep the widget height fixed and perhaps use scrolling or a summary view.

title: Improve UI of top navigation upon window resizing
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: When using top navigation, reducing the window width causes the navigation to abruptly jump to a sidebar layout (mobile mode). The user suggests smoothing this transition or refining the threshold, potentially hiding pages into a dropdown instead of a full sidebar.

title: Regression (1.50.0): widget value no longer updates when dependent on another widget
author: gotsysdba
summary: A regression in version 1.50.0 prevents widgets with a `key` from updating their value dynamically when a dependent widget changes. Previously, a widget could be reset via parameters if its dependency changed, but now the `key` seems to lock the state more aggressively.

title: minify index.hash.js for loading time improvement
author: rbosneag
summary: A user noticed that the main JavaScript bundle (`index.hash.js`) appears uncompressed/unminified, weighing around 1.8MB. They suggest minifying this file in the build pipeline to improve load times for production deployments. This is a performance optimization request.

title: Add help tooltips to individual buttons in `st.pills()` and `st.segmented_control()`
author: JosephMarinier
summary: The user wants to assign specific help tooltips to individual options within `st.pills` and `st.segmented_control`. This is particularly useful when the options are icons where the meaning might not be immediately obvious. Proposed APIs include passing a list of strings to `help`.

title: Allow st.markdown and st.write to be clickable
author: sfc-gh-tsingal
summary: Users want to attach `on_click` events to `st.markdown` and `st.write` elements. This would allow creating custom, clickable text elements that trigger Python callbacks, offering more design flexibility than standard buttons.

title: Control wrap behavior for text (`st.markdown`, `st.text`, ...)
author: jrieke
summary: Text in `st.markdown` automatically wraps to new lines, which can be undesirable in tight layouts. The request is to add a parameter (e.g., `wrap=False`) to prevent wrapping and instead truncate text with an ellipsis. This would give developers better control over text presentation.

title: Control wrap behavior for horizontal `st.container`
author: jrieke
summary: Horizontal containers currently enforce wrapping when elements exceed the available width. The request is to allow controlling this behavior, potentially disabling wrapping to force elements to stay in a single row. This would support layouts where a fixed horizontal strip of elements is required.

title: st.succes duration parameter (like in st.toast)
author: jensonjohnathon
summary: Status alerts like `st.success` and `st.error` persist on the page until manually removed. The user requests a `duration` parameter, similar to `st.toast`, to allow these alerts to auto-dismiss after a set time. This would reduce UI clutter.

title: Separate maxUploadSize configuration for st.chat_input and st.file_uploader
author: hamptonhangingpork
summary: Users request separate `maxUploadSize` configuration options for `st.chat_input` and `st.file_uploader`. This allows for different policies, such as allowing large datasets in a file uploader while restricting chat attachments to smaller files.

title: "Tertiary" `st.selectbox` without background
author: jrieke
summary: A design request to add a 'tertiary' style to `st.selectbox`, removing its background and border to make it look like plain text or a minimal dropdown. This would help create cleaner UIs where a full input box visual is unnecessary.

title: AppTest: Adding an element on rerun leads to KeyError in session_state
author: michue-work
summary: A `KeyError` occurs in `AppTest` when an app dynamically adds new widgets and updates others during a rerun. The testing framework fails to track the state correctly in this scenario. This indicates a bug in how `AppTest` handles dynamic widget IDs.

title: Allow HTML in `st.write_stream`
author: amanchaudhary-95
summary:
`st.write_stream` does not correctly render HTML tags (like `
`) inside Markdown, unlike `st.markdown`. This limitation breaks formatting when streaming content that relies on HTML. The request is to allow `unsafe_allow_html` within `st.write_stream`.

title: Allow control of overscroll behavior on mobile devices via config.toml
author: csipapicsa
summary: Mobile users on Streamlit Cloud often accidentally refresh the page via 'pull-to-refresh' overscroll behavior. The request is for a `config.toml` setting to disable this browser behavior natively, as standard CSS fixes do not work reliably in the Cloud environment.

title: Make `st.dialog(..., on_dismiss="rerun")` in a fragment rerun the full page instead of the fragment
author: AlePiccin
summary: When an `st.dialog` with `on_dismiss='rerun'` is used inside an `st.fragment`, dismissing the dialog only reruns the fragment, not the full app. The user expects the dismissal to trigger a full app rerun to reset the state globally.

title: st.login fails for users with large number of AD Groups using MS Entra OIDC Provider
author: JonathanAlles
summary: `st.login` fails for users belonging to many AD groups because the resulting identity token exceeds the browser's cookie size limit. The system should handle large tokens gracefully or provide a clear error message instead of silently failing.

title: Fragments within container disappearing on rerender
author: JosephMarinier
summary: `st.fragment` elements placed inside an `st.container` disappear after the first interaction/rerender under specific conditions. The initial render is correct, but subsequent updates cause the container content to vanish. This appears to be a bug.

title: /_stcore/health and /_stcore/host-config spamming on 403
author: H4dr1en
summary: When a Streamlit app loses access (e.g., VPN disconnection), the frontend continues to poll endpoints every 2 seconds, generating a flood of 403 Forbidden logs. The user suggests implementing an exponential backoff strategy to reduce log spam.

title: Option to edit user input in st.chat_message
author: dcoe-jkpaper
summary: Users request the ability to edit previously sent messages in `st.chat_message`. This would allow users to correct typos or modify prompts in a chat interface. Currently, chat messages are static once displayed.

title: Improve focus state of tertiary button
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: The focus/active state of tertiary buttons displays a red border that appears too tight to the text. The user suggests improving the styling by adding padding or adjusting the border placement to make it look less cramped.

title: Add `st.histogram_chart`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request a dedicated `st.histogram_chart` command for convenience. This command would abstract away the complexity of binning and configuration, offering parameters like `bins` and `density`. It aims to make exploratory data analysis faster.

title: Show unformatted date value in `st.column_config.DatetimeColumn`
author: femiadebayo
summary: When `DatetimeColumn` is configured to show relative times (e.g., '2 days ago'), the exact timestamp is hidden. Users request a hover tooltip that displays the precise date and time. This would allow users to see the 'friendly' format by default while still retaining precision.

title: Allow uploading images from camera in `st.chat_input`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want the ability to upload images directly from their device's camera or gallery via `st.chat_input`. This would streamline the workflow for mobile users sending photos in a chat interface.

title: Add `height` support to enable scrolling for more containers & elements
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request a `height` parameter for containers like `st.columns`, `st.tabs`, and `st.expander` to enable internal scrolling. This would allow developers to create fixed-height sections where content scrolls if it overflows, improving layout control.

title: `st.avatar` to show a standalone avatar image
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for a standalone `st.avatar` component to display user images, icons, or initials. Currently, avatars are mostly tied to chat messages. A dedicated component would allow avatars to be used in headers, profiles, or lists.

title: Show markdown footnotes as tooltips
author: lukasmasuch
summary: The user suggests that Markdown footnotes should render as interactive tooltips in Streamlit. Instead of jumping to the bottom of the page, hovering over the footnote citation would display the note content. This leverages existing Markdown parsing capabilities.

title: number_input cannot handle spaces in numbers in firefox
author: AlexAuragan
summary: In `st.number_input`, typing numbers with spaces (e.g., '100 000') fails or results in a `None` value, particularly in Firefox. The widget does not strip spaces or handle them gracefully. The request is to allow spaces in input and parse them correctly.

title: Optimize API for type checking with `ty`
author: RubenVanEldik
summary: The new Python type checker `ty` flags `st.stop()` as an invalid return type because it expects `NoReturn` but sees implicit `None`. This issue requests updating Streamlit's type hints to be compatible with `ty`'s strict analysis.

title: Make titles/headers align better in horizontal container
author: jrieke
summary: Titles and headers have default vertical padding that causes misalignment when placed next to other widgets in a horizontal container. The request is to adjust padding or alignment logic automatically when these elements are inside a horizontal layout.

title: Make charts use `textColor` for all text
author: jrieke
summary: Customizing the `textColor` in Streamlit's theme configuration does not propagate to charts (Altair/Plotly), which continue to use their default text colors. Charts should automatically inherit the global `textColor` setting for consistency.

title: Add theming config option to set the color of headings
author: jrieke
summary: The theming system allows customizing the font of headings but not their color independently of the global text. The user requests a new config option (e.g., `headingColor`) to define a specific color for titles and headers.

title: Ability to set background of st.container (or perhaps support for cards)
author: sfc-gh-tteixeira
summary: Users want the ability to set a background color for `st.container` or `st.columns`. This helps visually distinguish sections (creating a 'card' effect) without relying solely on borders. Proposed solutions include a new `st.card` component or style options.

title: Add title to status callouts (`st.info`, etc)
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.info, feature:st.success, feature:st.warning, feature:st.error
summary: `st.info`, `st.warning`, etc., currently display a simple message. Users request a `title` parameter to add a bold heading above the message text within the alert box. This would make the alerts more structured and descriptive.

title: `st.filter_bar` widget to filter dataframes
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A feature request for a high-level `st.filter_bar` widget that automatically generates UI filters for a given dataframe. This would replace the need for manually creating individual input widgets for each column to filter data.

title: Easier cross-filtering between charts/dataframes
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, feature:st.dataframe, feature:charts, feature:st.altair_chart, feature:st.vega_lite_chart, feature:st.plotly_chart, feature:st.pydeck_chart
summary: Users want a simpler way to implement cross-filtering between charts and dataframes, commonly found in BI dashboards. Currently, achieving this requires complex session state management and manual filtering logic, which triggers full page reruns. The request proposes a cleaner API, possibly via `on_select` syncing or a dedicated `st.cross_filter` command to link visualizations automatically.

title: Enable passing column_config to charting commands
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: This request suggests allowing `column_config` to be passed directly to charting commands like `st.altair_chart`. Since chart containers now include a toolbar button to view underlying data, users want to format that data presentation (e.g., number formatting) just like in `st.dataframe`. Currently, the raw data is shown without customization options unless displayed separately.

title: Fixing state management issues with Streamlit's st.pills component where selections get reset when available options change dynamically and pills require double-clicks to toggle
author: bartekkuzma
summary: The user is experiencing state management bugs with `st.pills` when options change dynamically based on parent selections. Specifically, previously selected items get cleared unexpectedly when new options are added, and toggling selection sometimes requires double-clicks. The desired behavior is for valid selections to persist across updates and for single-click toggling to work consistently.

title: Regression in v1.49.0 when showing layered altair chart in dialog - tooltips not showing when a facet option is specified
author: marawanokasha
labels: type:bug, type:regression, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.altair_chart, feature:st.vega_lite_chart
summary: A regression in version 1.49.0 causes tooltips in layered Altair charts to disappear for all but the last layer when displayed inside an `st.dialog`. This issue only occurs when a facet encoding (like color) is used, whereas it works correctly on the main page. The expected behavior is for tooltips to function on all layers regardless of the container.

title: Update error dialogs to be more helpful
author: lukasmasuch
summary: The current error dialogs for connection timeouts and other states are generic and don't clearly instruct the user on how to resolve the issue. The proposal is to update the text to be more actionable, such as explicitly suggesting a page reload or contacting the app builder. This would improve the user experience during error states.

title: Set default zoom level of `st.pdf`
author: amanchaudhary-95
summary: The `st.pdf` component lacks customization options for the initial view. Users request parameters to set the default zoom level, width, and potentially the starting page number. This would allow the PDF viewer to open in a state that is optimized for the specific document being displayed.

title: Copy text from `st.pdf`
author: amanchaudhary-95
summary: The current `st.pdf` implementation renders PDFs as images, preventing users from selecting and copying text. This limits usability for users who need to extract information from documents. The request is to enable text selection and copying within the PDF viewer, possibly by using a different rendering method or configuration.

title: Download the pdf file in `st.pdf`
author: amanchaudhary-95
summary: While `st.pdf` allows viewing documents, it lacks a native download or print button. Users often need to save the PDF locally after viewing it. The request is to add built-in functionality to download or print the PDF directly from the viewer component.

title: Support for Multiple Named Custom Themes
author: h0tzerapyc
summary: Currently, Streamlit only supports a single custom theme in `config.toml`. This request proposes allowing multiple named themes to be defined in the configuration. This would enable users to switch between different custom looks (e.g., "Corporate Light" vs. "Midnight Dark") based on context or preference, similar to IDE theme switching.

title: Error when using st.segmented_control: ValueError 'content: O is not in list' at second call to run()
author: r0mac09
summary: A `ValueError` occurs in `st.segmented_control` during testing with `AppTest` when a default value is set and a button is clicked. The error suggests an internal issue with how indices are calculated or tracked in the testing framework. A potential fix involving list comprehension updates in `element_tree.py` is suggested.

title: Add sections to `st.multiselect` options
author: jrieke
summary: For long lists of options in `st.multiselect`, users want the ability to group items into labeled sections (e.g., "Fruits", "Dairy"). This would improve navigation and readability compared to a flat list. The implementation could use a dictionary format for options similar to `st.navigation`.

title: Add support for dynamic tab badges or persistent tab keys
author: pallagj
summary: `st.tabs` resets the selected tab whenever the tab titles are updated, which disrupts UX when trying to show dynamic counters (like notification badges) in the title. The user requests a way to update tab titles or add badges without forcing a reset of the active tab. Solutions could include a dedicated `badge` parameter or persistent keys for tabs.

title: Customize quick select ranges/visibility in `st.date_input`
author: nbily1
summary: The "quick select" dropdown added to `st.date_input` is not always relevant, especially for use cases like selecting future dates. Users want a parameter (e.g., `quick_select=False`) to hide this dropdown when it doesn't add value. This would declutter the UI and prevent user confusion.

title: Support additional export formats for `st.dataframe`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Currently, `st.dataframe` only supports CSV export. The request is to expand the download toolbar to support other common formats such as Excel, Parquet, JSON, or PDF. This would provide more flexibility for users who need data in specific formats for downstream workflows.

title: Add clickable actions to alert elements
author: lukasmasuch
labels: type:enhancement, feature:st.info, feature:st.success, feature:st.warning, feature:st.error, feature:st.exception
summary: Users want to add interactive buttons or actions directly within alert elements like `st.success` or `st.info`. For example, a "View status" button could be embedded in a success message. This allows for clearer calls to action associated with specific system states.

title: Streamlit is incredibly slow at calling anything via OpenRouter's API
author: apotenza92
labels: type:bug, area:performance, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.write_stream, area:integrations
summary: A user reports severe performance degradation when making calls to the OpenRouter API from within Streamlit compared to a standard Python script. The slowdown is significant (up to 16x slower) and seems specific to the Streamlit environment. The issue persists even when using the OpenAI client with the OpenRouter base URL.

title: Add clickable actions to `st.metric`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Similar to the request for alerts, this proposes adding clickable actions to `st.metric` cards. This could manifest as links or buttons (e.g., "View more") associated with a specific metric. It would enable users to drill down into data or trigger workflows directly from a KPI display.

title: When uploading multiple files with st.chat_input, the X to remove file is not visually close to its file
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: In `st.chat_input`, when multiple files are uploaded, the "X" button to remove a file is positioned equidistantly between file icons, making it unclear which file it belongs to. This visual ambiguity confuses users. The UI needs adjustment to clearly associate the delete button with its respective file.

title: Make all widgets use the same font size
author: jrieke
summary: Streamlit widgets currently use a mix of 16px (e.g., buttons, selectbox) and 14px (e.g., pills, segmented control) font sizes. This inconsistency causes alignment issues and visual jaggedness when placing different widgets side-by-side. The proposal is to standardize the font size across all widgets for a more cohesive look.

title: Horizontal bar chart column for `st.dataframe`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want a column type in `st.dataframe` that renders a horizontal bar chart filling the cell background, similar to a progress bar but potentially more flexible. This would allow for quick visual comparison of values within the table. It could be a new `HorizontalBarChartColumn` or an enhancement to `ProgressColumn`.

title: Native Real-Time Collaboration - st.collaborate() API
author: Tomserre
summary: This is a major feature request for native real-time collaboration, allowing multiple users to interact with the same app session simultaneously. The proposed `st.collaborate()` API would sync widget states across participants via WebSockets. This aims to support team workflows, shared dashboards, and interactive presentations.

title: Allow st.dataframe width and height to be specified in columns and rows instead of pixels
author: cjw296
summary: Specifying `st.dataframe` dimensions in pixels is often difficult when the goal is to show a specific amount of data. The request is to allow setting width and height in terms of rows and columns (e.g., `max_rows=15`). This would simplify layout configuration for dynamic datasets.

title: New options at beginning of st.selectbox
author: mkubi84
summary: When `accept_new_options` is enabled in `st.selectbox`, the option to add a new item appears at the bottom of the list. For long lists, this requires scrolling, which is inefficient. The user requests the ability to move this "add" option to the top for quicker access.

title: Support Apache ECharts natively
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Apache ECharts is a popular visualization library, currently supported via a custom component that is no longer maintained. Given its popularity and extensive chart types, the request is to add native support for ECharts (`st.echarts_chart`) to Streamlit, complementing Altair and Plotly.

title: Add shadow around `st.container`
author: jrieke
summary: Users want to add a shadow effect to `st.container` to create a "card" look, common in modern dashboards. This would involve a new parameter (e.g., `shadow=True`) or theme setting. It would improve the visual hierarchy and separation of content sections.

title: Change `st.metric` font size and weight through theming
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:theming, feature:st.metric
summary: The styling of `st.metric` values is currently hardcoded. Users request new theming options (`metricValueFontSize`, `metricValueFontWeight`) to customize the appearance of metric numbers. This is important for matching corporate branding or specific dashboard designs.

title: Make `st.area_chart` have the same design as the area chart in `st.metric`
author: jrieke
summary: The sparkline area charts in `st.metric` use a modern design with a line and muted fill. Users want `st.area_chart` to adopt this same aesthetic by default, replacing the current, more basic look. This would unify the visual language of charts across the library.

title: Icon for `st.metric`
author: jrieke
summary: Many dashboards include icons alongside metrics to provide visual context. The request is to add an `icon` parameter to `st.metric`, allowing developers to display an icon (like a Material symbol) within the metric card. This would reduce the need for custom HTML/CSS workarounds.

title: Color positive and negative bars in `st.column_config.BarChartColumn`, `st.metric`, and maybe `st.bar_chart`
author: sfc-gh-jrieke
summary: Users request the ability to automatically color bars green for positive values and red for negative values in chart columns and metrics. This visual cue is standard in financial and data dashboards. The feature should apply to `BarChartColumn`, `st.metric` charts, and potentially `st.bar_chart`.

title: Add a search bar feature in column visibility menu selection
author: plumol
summary: For dataframes with many columns, the visibility toggle menu becomes hard to navigate. The request is to add a search bar within the column visibility dropdown. This would allow users to quickly find and toggle specific columns by name.

title: Specify precision when using "compact" formatting
author: OrthelT
summary: When using `format="compact"` in `NumberColumn`, precision is often lost (e.g., 12,000,000 becomes 12M). Users want a `precision` parameter to control the number of decimal places in the compact view (e.g., display 12.21M instead). This ensures data remains informative while concise.

title: `st.divider` should have equal space above and below
author: jrieke
summary: Currently, `st.divider` has unequal margins, with more space above than below. This creates an unbalanced look. The request is to equalize the vertical margins for dividers, consistent with other layout elements, to improve visual symmetry.

title: Regression: Selectbox/Multiselect keyboard focus not activating on mobile (only works in desktop mode)
author: gquinche
summary: On mobile devices, tapping into `st.selectbox` or `st.multiselect` opens the menu but fails to trigger the keyboard for searching. This forces users to switch to "Desktop mode" to type. This is a regression, as previous versions handled mobile focus correctly.

title: Support for a bigger, more comprehensive st.segmented_control
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: The user requests a more prominent, high-level selection widget, similar to a large segmented control used in a specific Streamlit tool. This "hero" widget would serve as a clear top-level filter for the page, visually distinct from standard controls.

title: Disable individual options in st.pills or st.segmented_control
author: arnaudmiribel
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.segmented_control, feature:st.pills
summary: Users want to disable specific options within `st.pills` or `st.segmented_control` without hiding them. This would be done by passing a list of booleans or indices to a `disabled` parameter. It allows showing all possibilities while restricting interaction based on logic.

title: Advanced Navigation Menu: Collapsible Groups, Hover, Pinning, Counters
author: pallagj
summary: This request outlines a wish list for an advanced navigation sidebar similar to GitLab's. Features include hover expansion, collapsible groups, pinning pages, and badge counters for items. These enhancements would make navigation in complex apps more powerful and intuitive.

title: Multiple dashboards open locally with same oauth configuration
author: velochy
summary: Developing multiple apps locally with OAuth is difficult because the `redirect_uri` is often hardcoded to a specific port (e.g., 8501). The user suggests allowing the `redirect_uri` to default to the current port dynamically. This would enable running multiple auth-enabled apps simultaneously on different ports.

title: Support Folium maps natively
author: jrieke
summary: `streamlit-folium` is a widely used custom component for geospatial visualization. Given its popularity over native PyDeck options, the request is to integrate Folium support directly into Streamlit as `st.folium_chart`. This would provide a robust, supported geospatial tool out of the box.

title: Show a button in the top navigation bar
author: jrieke
summary: Users want to place a generic action button in the top navigation bar (e.g., for "Logout", "Settings", or "Links"). Currently, this area is restricted to page navigation. Adding a button here would allow for global app actions that are always accessible.

title: Multi-column selections in `st.dataframe` should be additive
author: jrieke
summary: When multi-column selection is enabled, clicking a column header currently deselects others unless Shift is held. This behavior is unfriendly on mobile where Shift-click isn't possible. The request is to make column selection additive by default (click to toggle) to improve usability.

title: Shorten numbers in `st.metric`
author: jrieke
summary: Users currently have to use external libraries to format large numbers (e.g., "100k") in metrics. The request is to add native "compact" formatting support to `st.metric`, similar to `NumberColumn`. This would make displaying readable KPIs easier.

title: Sidebar Header layout to inherit from App Header
author: alex-bork
summary: The user wants the sidebar header to match the layout and styling of the main app header for branding consistency. Recent updates broke a workaround that achieved this. The request is for native support or a reliable way to unify the header design across the sidebar and main area.

title: Change background color of top navigation bar
author: cppratt1
summary: The top navigation bar currently uses the default theme colors. Users want to customize its background color to differentiate it from the content or match specific branding. A `background_color` or style parameter in `st.navigation` is requested.

title: Add `height="stretch"` to `st.tabs`
author: injeniero
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, area:layout, feature:st.tabs
summary: Recent layout updates added `height` controls to containers, but `st.tabs` was not updated. Users want `st.tabs` to support `height="stretch"` so that tab content can fill the available vertical space. This is necessary for fully responsive, full-height layouts using tabs.

title: Show chart data for Plotly charts
author: jrieke
summary: Streamlit is adding a "view data" toolbar button for Altair charts. This request is to extend that same functionality to Plotly charts. It would allow users to inspect the underlying dataframe of a Plotly visualization directly within the app.

title: Automatically reformat in CI on lint failure
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: Currently, CI fails if linting checks (like `ruff format`) fail. The suggestion is to have CI automatically apply formatting fixes and commit them, rather than just failing. This improves developer quality of life by handling routine formatting tasks automatically.

title: Make `key` on `st.dataframe` work in app testing
author: Nicknamen
summary: In the `AppTest` framework, `st.dataframe` (and metrics) cannot be accessed by their `key`, unlike other widgets. The request is to enable key-based access for these elements in tests. This would make writing robust tests for dataframes easier.

title: AdvancedLayouts 'content' width option for `st.container`
author: nilcam
summary: The preview for FlexLayouts allowed `width='content'` for containers, but the release version removed it. Users want this feature back to allow containers to shrink-wrap their width to their content. This is useful for creating adaptive layouts.

title: Content width for st.write
author: dcoe-jkpaper
summary: `st.write` does not accept a `width` parameter, causing it to always fill the width even inside centered containers. Users want `st.write` (and `st.markdown`) to respect container alignment or accept a `width='content'` parameter to align text properly in flex layouts.

title: st.image_upload
author: shakamoushie
summary: Users request a component that combines image display with upload functionality, similar to changing a profile picture. Clicking the image would trigger an upload prompt to replace it. This would streamline UIs where updating an image is a primary action.

title: Frequent websocket connection drops on higher (default 30s) ping_interval
author: MaxvandenBoom
summary: An update to Tornado 6.5.1 in Streamlit 1.47.0 caused frequent WebSocket connection drops for some users, particularly those behind proxies/Nginx. The issue relates to the `ping_interval` setting. The user requests stability improvements for higher ping intervals or compatibility with newer Tornado versions without drops.

title: Support text/content align in st.dataframe
author: jhanggi
summary: Users want to control the text alignment (left, center, right) of cells within `st.dataframe`. Currently, alignment is often automatic based on type. The request is to expose an alignment option in `column_config` or Pandas styler support for better table presentation.

title: static images served by streamlit should work on all image compatible features
author: injeniero
labels: type:enhancement, feature:st.image, feature:st.audio, feature:st.video, feature:st.set_page_config, feature:st.chat_message
summary: Streamlit's static file serving works for `st.image` via URL but not seamlessly for other image-accepting arguments like `avatar` in `st.chat_message` or `page_icon` in `st.set_page_config`. The request is to support local static paths uniformly across all image-related parameters for consistency and performance.

title: st.image shows up in profile as the cause of slow app run
author: injeniero
summary: Profiling reveals that `st.image` re-processes image data on every run, even if the image hasn't changed. This causes unnecessary performance overhead. The expected behavior is for `st.image` to cache processed images or avoid redundant work on reruns to speed up app rendering.

title: Include all warnings (not just deprecation warnings) in `client.showErrorDetails`
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: The `client.showErrorDetails` config currently only suppresses deprecation warnings when set to "none". Other warnings still show full stack traces. The request is to make this setting apply to *all* warnings to allow for cleaner production apps without debug clutter.

title: Slow Rendering Of Large Pages (Many Widgets)
author: i3130002
summary: A user reports slow rendering times for pages with many widgets (e.g., 500+ inputs). The profiling indicates bottlenecks in the frontend rendering or data transfer. The request is to optimize rendering performance for pages with high widget counts to improve responsiveness.

title: More flexibility in st.logo width and height
author: neuspou
summary: `st.logo` is optimized for rectangular logos, making square logos appear too small. The user requests parameters to adjust the height and width of the logo explicitly. This would allow for better branding presentation regardless of logo aspect ratio.

title: Visual gap between dataframe border and background
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: There is a visual defect in `st.dataframe` headers where the border radius doesn't match the background, creating a gap. This looks like a styling bug. The goal is to fix the CSS to ensure the header background cleanly fills the bordered area.

title: RuntimeError: Event loop is closed with st.stream_write while using Langgraph astream
author: amanchaudhary-95
summary: Using `st.write_stream` with an async generator from LangGraph inside a cached function causes a `RuntimeError: Event loop is closed` after the first interaction. This suggests a conflict between Streamlit's caching mechanism, async loop handling, and the streaming widget. The user needs a fix to allow robust async streaming from cached resources.

title: st.empty does not clear removed elements
author: injeniero
summary: `st.empty()` containers fail to clear old elements if the new content has fewer items than the previous render. Ghost elements remain visible. The expected behavior is for `st.empty()` to completely wipe its previous content before rendering new content, ensuring a clean state.

title: `st.feedback` shouldn't wrap
author: jrieke
labels: type:bug, good first issue, area:layout, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.feedback
summary: When `st.feedback` is constrained by a small width, the icons (e.g., stars) wrap to a new line, which looks broken. The component should enforce a minimum width or prevent wrapping to keep the icons in a single row, preserving the UI integrity.

title: Sidebar remains open when navigating through pages with `initial_sidebar_state="collapsed"`
author: gRodrigues03
summary: Recent changes have broken sidebar behavior: navigating between pages fails to respect `initial_sidebar_state="collapsed"`, keeping the sidebar open if it was previously open. Users expect the sidebar state to reset based on the page config upon navigation.

title: Thread 'ThreadPoolExecutor-4_0': missing ScriptRunContext! This warning can be ignored when running in bare mode.
author: mohankumarelec
summary: LangChain callbacks running in separate threads lose the Streamlit script context, causing warnings and failures in `st.write`. This is a concurrency issue. The request is to better support context propagation or provide a pattern to handle threaded callbacks without losing the session context.

title: Some suggestions for improving `dataframe`
author: ghilesmeddour
summary: A user provides a list of improvements for `st.dataframe`, including removing unnecessary scrollbars, improving null value formatting, adding visual truncation indicators, and fixing search highlighting issues. These are quality-of-life enhancements for the dataframe widget.

title: Allow selection of `st.popover` body placement
author: kevinvayro
summary: `st.popover` currently defaults to opening to the bottom-left, which can cause misalignment in custom layouts. Users request a parameter to control the popover's opening direction (e.g., bottom-right, top). This would allow for better UI alignment in various container contexts.

title: Memory leak when using `@keras.saving.register_keras_serializable` with Streamlit
author: Napuh
summary: A memory leak is reported when using Keras models with the serializable decorator in Streamlit. Memory usage grows with each rerun. This suggests an issue with how Streamlit handles or retains references to these specific Keras objects across reruns.

title: Option to refresh user info for user authenticated via st.login
author: velochy
summary: For apps using `st.login` (OIDC), there is no way to refresh user information (like updated permissions or language preference) without a full logout/login. The request is for an `st.refresh_user()` command to query the provider for updated claims and refresh tokens without breaking the session.

title: Make `st.pills` and `st.segmented_control` look nicer with `width="stretch"` and wrapping
author: jrieke
summary: When `st.pills` with `width="stretch"` wraps to a new line, the distribution of pills is uneven (e.g., one long pill on the second line). The request is to improve the layout logic to distribute items more evenly across lines for a more balanced appearance.

title: Create an interface to manage frontend state
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: The proposal suggests a new `st.frontend_state` API to manage purely frontend interactions like widget focus, sidebar collapse/expand, or temporary disabling, without triggering backend reruns. This would allow for finer UI control separate from the data-driving `st.session_state`.

title: Make `st.context.ip_address` work with a proxy or load balancer by setting Tornado's `xheaders` parameter
author: adamalton
summary: `st.context.ip_address` returns `None` behind proxies because Tornado's `xheaders` option is not enabled by default in Streamlit. The request is to enable this setting to correctly parse `X-Forwarded-For` headers, allowing IP detection in production environments.

title: Minor styling issue with data editor causing highlight color to be clipped
author: sfc-gh-nbellante
labels: type:bug, feature:st.dataframe, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.data_editor, upstream
summary: A visual bug in `st.data_editor` causes the cell highlight color to be clipped or misaligned. This is a minor CSS/styling regression that needs fixing to ensure the editor looks polished.

title: Add new element for floating table of contents
author: nchammas
summary: Users want a native `st.toc()` widget to generate a table of contents from the page's Markdown headers. Ideally, this would float on the side (like in Streamlit docs) or be placeable within the page. This improves navigation for long, document-heavy apps.

title: `st.code` with large text is causing a RangeError
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Rendering very large text blocks (e.g., >30MB) in `st.code` crashes the frontend with a `RangeError`. The issue seems related to the syntax highlighter struggling with massive inputs. Streamlit should handle large code blocks more gracefully, perhaps by truncating or virtually scrolling.

title: Focus `st.chat_input` on any key press
author: jrieke
summary: To match the experience of other chat apps (like ChatGPT), users suggest automatically focusing `st.chat_input` when the user starts typing, provided no other input is focused. This streamlines the chat experience by removing the need to click the input box first.

title: Don't show JPG and JPEG on `st.file_uploader`
author: sfc-gh-jrieke
summary: `st.file_uploader` displays both "jpg" and "jpeg" in the accepted types list, which is redundant. The request is to deduplicate these in the UI, showing only "jpg" to keep the interface cleaner while still accepting both extensions.

title: New element to show a file, e.g. in `st.chat_message`
author: jrieke
summary: Chat interfaces often need to display uploaded files as "chips" or cards within the message stream. The request is for a new element (e.g., `st.file_chip`) that renders a file attachment with a download option and preview, standardizing file presentation in chat.

title: Add marks to `st.select_slider`
author: jrieke
summary: Users want to add visual tick marks to `st.select_slider` to indicate available options along the track. This would improve usability by showing the discrete positions the slider can snap to, similar to the `marks` feature in standard sliders.

title: Ability to Set Default Sidebar Width
author: jose-mindwayai
summary: Recent updates changed the default sidebar width, affecting some app layouts. Users want a configuration option in `config.toml` to set a custom default width for the sidebar. This ensures consistent layout across sessions without relying on fragile CSS hacks.

title: `theme.chartCategoricalColors` requires a full reload to be applied to Plotly charts
author: jrieke
summary: Changing chart theme colors in `config.toml` doesn't update Plotly charts upon a simple rerun; a full browser reload is required. This is a bug, as Altair charts update immediately. Plotly charts should respect theme changes dynamically.

title: Vertical st.segmented_control
author: nidoro
summary: The `st.segmented_control` is horizontal by default. Users request a vertical layout option (e.g., `layout="vertical"`) to stack segments. This is useful for sidebars or narrow containers where horizontal space is limited.

title: SelectboxColumn in data editor not working when fragment with run_every is active
author: LukasK13
summary: A bug where an active `st.fragment` (running periodically) causes open selectboxes in a `data_editor` to reset their scroll position. This makes it impossible to select options lower down in the list. The editor's state should be isolated from unrelated fragment updates.

title: Issue with creating a multi-page Streamlit app with custom navigation in the sidebar.
author: sfc-gh-asrivastava
summary: The user reports that `showSidebarNavigation = false` in `config.toml` is failing to hide the default sidebar navigation for multipage apps. This prevents custom navigation implementations from working as expected. It seems to be a configuration parsing or application issue.

title: `st.cache_data` interfering with custom component
author: davidhu-openai
summary: A user reports that `st.cache_data` usage interferes with a custom component, causing the first interaction to be ignored or misdirected. This suggests a potential conflict between the caching mechanism's replay logic and the custom component's state synchronization.

title: Support showing links in NumberColumns
author: arkadyark-cohere
summary: `NumberColumn` supports formatting but not hyperlinks. Users want to display numbers that are also clickable links (e.g., clicking a metric to drill down). The request is to add a `url` parameter to `NumberColumn` configuration, combining numeric formatting with link functionality.

title: Consistent API for selectbox/pills/segmented_control/radio
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: The APIs for selection widgets (`st.selectbox`, `st.radio`, `st.pills`, etc.) have inconsistent parameter names (e.g., `index` vs `default`). The request is to standardize these arguments across all selection components to improve developer experience and API consistency.

title: `theme.dataframeHeaderBackgroundColor` shows incorrect color and changing appearance when it includes an alpha value
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: When `dataframeHeaderBackgroundColor` includes transparency, the header renders as almost black initially and shifts colors on hover. This is a rendering bug related to how transparency is handled in the dataframe theme. The header color should remain consistent.

title: select box does not support multiple not unique labels anymore. v.1.46.1
author: JurijsNazarovs
summary: `st.selectbox` used to support duplicate labels mapped to unique IDs, but a recent update broke this. Now, selecting a duplicate label always returns the last ID associated with that label. Users need the ability to distinguish between identical labels with different underlying values.

title: Colored badges as dataframe columns
author: quantoid
summary: Users want a column type in `st.dataframe` that renders values as colored badges (like `st.badge`). This is useful for displaying status fields (e.g., "Open", "Closed") with visual distinction. It could be a new `BadgeColumn` configuration.

title: Add interactive options to the app menu via `st.set_page_config`
author: OutOfRatRace
summary: Users want to add custom items to the top-right "hamburger" menu, such as "Logout" or "Help". Currently, developers clutter the UI with buttons for these. Moving them to the app menu would provide a cleaner, more standard application interface.

title: Make `st.context.theme` work in all situations
author: jrieke
summary: `st.context.theme` sometimes fails to return the correct active theme (light/dark), particularly on the first run or in multipage apps. This API needs to be reliable so developers can adjust their app's styling dynamically based on the user's theme.

title: Make component source URL handling consistent for `url`/`path` sources
author: vdonato
summary: Custom components handle `url` and `path` sources differently regarding `index.html`. For `path`, `index.html` is appended automatically, but for `url`, it is not. The request is to make `url` handling implicitly support `index.html` to match standard web server behavior and consistency with `path`.

title: `st.data_editor` column dtype inconsistency
author: rhelouREV
summary: `st.data_editor` changes column types from integer to string if the column headers are integers. This unexpected type coercion breaks downstream logic that expects integer keys. The editor should preserve the original data types of the DataFrame.

title: Add "Select All" and "Deselect All" buttons to st.pills widget
author: gRodrigues03
summary: For `st.pills` with many options, users request built-in "Select All" and "Deselect All" controls. This improves usability for filtering use cases where toggling everything at once is a common action.

title: Turn submit button in `st.chat_input` into stop button
author: jrieke
summary: In chat interfaces, users want the submit button to transform into a "Stop" button during generation. This allows users to interrupt long responses, similar to ChatGPT. This would require a mechanism to trigger `st.stop` or interrupt the backend execution.

title: In `st.chat_input` on mobile, make "Enter" create a new line instead of submitting
author: jrieke
summary: On mobile devices, the "Enter" key in `st.chat_input` submits the message, preventing users from creating multi-line messages easily. The request is to change "Enter" to insert a newline on mobile, requiring a tap on the submit button to send, which matches standard mobile chat UX.

title: Add support for anchor tag hyperlinks in Column Configuration for st.dataframe
author: cewebber
summary: `LinkColumn` currently assumes all links are external or absolute paths. Users want support for anchor tags (e.g., `#section`) to jump to locations within the same page. The current behavior breaks these links by malforming the URL.

title: Add back support broken emoji shortcodes from before 1.46
author: vldryz
summary: An update in 1.46 broke support for certain emoji shortcodes (e.g., flag codes). Users want this regression fixed to restore the previous emoji rendering capabilities, as it affects visual consistency in apps relying on these codes.

title: Allow manual sorting of st.dataframe while using sort headers
author: nhansendev
summary: Users want to handle sorting manually in the backend (e.g., for large datasets) while still using the dataframe's header sort UI. The request is for a "manual sort" mode that exposes the sort state without automatically sorting the data in the frontend.

title: Export to PDF
author: jrieke
summary: Users request a native "Export to PDF" feature in the app menu. While browser printing works, a dedicated option would be more discoverable and potentially offer better control over the output layout, ensuring the app renders correctly as a document.

title: Sort LinkColumn in st.dataframe by display_text
author: brynpickering
summary: `LinkColumn` sorts by the underlying URL, which is often not what users expect when a display text is shown. The request is to allow sorting by the `display_text` instead, ensuring the sort order matches what the user sees in the table.

title: Add an option to show the sidebar below the top navigation menu
author: hansthen
summary: Users request an option to position the sidebar below the top navigation menu. Currently, the sidebar displaces the top navigation, causing UI instability when toggled. A configuration in `st.navigation` or `st.page_layout` is proposed to decouple the sidebar layout from the navigation bar.

title: Add `key` to all components.
author: lix8886
summary: A request to add a `key` parameter to all Streamlit components, particularly layout elements like `st.columns`. This would improve UI customizability and state management consistency across the entire API.

title: Support Markdown in the options of `st.select_slider`
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:markdown, feature:st.select_slider
summary: Users want Markdown support for options in `st.select_slider`. This would allow for rich text formatting (e.g., bolding, italics) within the slider's selection labels, working alongside `format_func`.

title: Support Markdown in the value and delta of `st.metric`
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:markdown, feature:st.metric
summary: While `st.metric` labels support Markdown, the value and delta parameters do not. The request is to extend Markdown support to these fields to allow for custom formatting of metric numbers and indicators.

title: Support Markdown in the `placeholder` parameter of input widgets
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:markdown, feature:st.number_input, feature:st.selectbox, feature:st.text_input, feature:st.multiselect, feature:st.text_area, feature:st.chat_input
summary: Users request Markdown support for `placeholder` text in input widgets like `st.text_input` and `st.selectbox`. This would enable styled instructions or hints within empty fields.

title: Support Markdown in the title of `st.Page`
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:markdown, feature:multipage-apps
summary: The `title` parameter in `st.Page` should support Markdown rendering. This allows for formatted titles in the sidebar or top navigation bar, aligning `st.Page` with other components.

title: Bottom padding in app menu is too small
author: jrieke
