summary: There is a visual bug where the bottom padding in the app menu is inconsistent and smaller than the top padding. The user suggests fixing this alignment issue to improve the menu's aesthetics.

title: Add icon to st.header and st.subheader (and st.markdown?)
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: Users want an `icon` parameter for `st.header` and `st.subheader` to easily align icons next to headings. This would simplify adding visual flair to titles without manual Markdown formatting.

title: Make pixel widths/heights adjust to `baseFontSize`
author: jrieke
summary: Pixel-based dimensions in widgets do not scale with `baseFontSize` theme settings. The proposal is to make these dimensions responsive to font size changes or allow `rem` units for better accessibility.

title: Support local font files for `fontFaces` and/or `font` in theming
author: jrieke
summary: Theming configuration for `fontFaces` currently requires external URLs. The request is to allow referencing local font files directly by path in `config.toml`, simplifying custom font usage.

title: Submitting Feedback for Previous Answers Interrupts Ongoing Answer Generation
author: tigranmargaryan13
summary: Submitting feedback on a previous chat message interrupts the generation of the current streaming response. The expected behavior is for the stream to continue uninterrupted while feedback is processed.

title: Contribution documentation suggestions
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: A contributor suggests updates to the "Contributing" wiki regarding Streamlit build instructions on Ubuntu WSL. They provide specific tips on dependencies and permissions that are currently missing.

title: Pass additional theming configs to glide for `st.dataframe`
author: mayagbarnes
summary: Theme settings `linkUnderline` and `baseFontWeight` do not apply to `st.dataframe` due to upstream library limitations. This issue tracks the need to support these styling options once possible.

title: Make elements take up a relative amount of available width
author: lix8886
summary: The `width` parameter currently restricts users to integers or 'stretch'. Users request support for float values to specify width as a percentage of the parent container for responsive layouts.

title: Set custom theme for `st.json`
author: jrieke
summary: `st.json` uses hardcoded syntax highlighting themes. The request is to use Streamlit's own theme colors for JSON rendering to ensure design consistency with the rest of the app.

title: Allow advanced customization of OIDC/OAuth2 parameters in st.login()
author: Klx-Cody
summary: `st.login()` hardcodes OIDC parameters, limiting advanced use cases. Developers need a way to customize parameters like `scope` and `audience` via a `client_kwargs` argument to support specific auth providers.

title: Only evaluate/download required columns when using an unevaluated Snowpark/PySpark dataframe in charts
author: jrieke
summary: When using large, unevaluated dataframes in charts, Streamlit evaluates the data before filtering columns. The suggestion is to drop unused columns first to improve performance for datasets with many columns.

title: Concurrency issues with `st.data_editor` `on_change` callback: Using the `session_state` of the `st.data_editor` leads to multiple processing or potential data loss
author: dr-jpk-be
summary: Concurrency issues in `st.data_editor` cause user edits to be processed multiple times or lost. This happens when the `on_change` callback relies on stale session state. A native fix for handling concurrent edits is requested.

title: A long sidebar allows the collapse control to get scrolled out of view preventing sidebar collapsing
author: sfc-gh-nbellante
summary: In long sidebars, scrolling moves the collapse button out of view. Users want the collapse control to remain accessible regardless of scroll position to easily close the sidebar.

title: st.markdown links not parsed correctly when content enclosed in div
author: lstolcman
summary: Markdown links break when enclosed in HTML `div` tags within `st.markdown`. The parser fails to render them as clickable links. Users want to combine HTML layout with standard Markdown links.

title: Websocket Notify component to allow for Push-Notifications without polling
author: rwa96
summary: Users request a component to trigger server-side reruns via WebSocket push notifications. This would eliminate polling for real-time apps like chatrooms or live dashboards.

title: Add the ability to mute/disable messages logged by the Logger
author: skasero
summary: A developer requests a way to globally suppress specific log messages from Streamlit. This is to reduce noise from repetitive debug logs when running Streamlit in API-heavy environments.

title: Show hex colors in Markdown, similar to GitHub
author: jrieke
summary: GitHub renders hex color codes with a small color preview dot. The request is for Streamlit's Markdown to support this feature, providing visual cues for color codes.

title: Share button should keep hover background & pointer cursor when clicked
author: jrieke
summary: The "Share" button in the app menu loses its hover styling immediately upon click, unlike other menu items. The request is to fix this inconsistency for better visual feedback.

title: Sort dropdown options in `st.selectbox` and `st.multiselect`
author: jrieke
summary: Search results in selectboxes are sorted by match relevance. Users want an option to force a specific sort order (e.g., alphabetical) regardless of the search query.

title: Add a command or menu item to help developers diagnose their environments
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Developers need a built-in command to diagnose the runtime environment (versions, packages) of deployed apps. This would help debug discrepancies between local and production environments.

title: `make frontend-dev`  fails during build under WSL2
author: kamy-dev
summary: `make frontend-dev` fails on WSL2 due to `yarn` workspace issues. The issue tracks this specific build failure and provides error logs for troubleshooting.

title: data_editor: Allow disabled cell to be entered when adding a new row.
author: kaizen63
summary: Disabled columns in `st.data_editor` prevent data entry for new rows. Users want `required` fields to override the `disabled` state during row creation to allow inputting keys.

title: Sticky `st.expander` header
author: davidhu-openai
summary: Users want a "sticky" header for `st.expander` so the label remains visible while scrolling through long content. This improves navigation within expanded sections.

title: `st.thread` object for chains of `st.chat_message`
author: davidhu-openai
summary: Managing long chat histories is difficult. The user proposes an `st.thread` object to manage message groups, enabling features like collapsing and lazy loading for chat performance.

title: Navigation through long `st.chat` blocks
author: davidhu-openai
summary: Navigating long chat threads needs better UX. The request is to add a minimap or scrollbar to `st.chat_message` blocks to help users jump to specific parts of the conversation.

title: Access post request object
author: kstan79
summary: A user embedding Streamlit via iframe wants to access HTTP POST request data within the app. This allows passing large variables that exceed URL query string limits.

title: ButtonGroup.select() fails when options use format_func or are not primitive strings
author: dmitrkozlovsk
summary: `AppTest` fails when selecting options in `ButtonGroup` if the options are objects. The framework expects strings, breaking tests for apps using `format_func` with complex objects.

title: Expose all theming config options in `st.context.theme`
author: jrieke
summary: `st.context.theme` exposes the theme type but not specific config values. The request is to expose all theme settings (e.g., primary color) to allow apps to adapt logic based on style.

title: Differently colored tags in st.multiselect
author: LPHallo
summary: Users want to assign individual colors to tags in `st.multiselect`. A `tag_colors` parameter is proposed to coordinate tag styling with other visualizations.

title: Custom bi-directional component - how to extend native/base widgets/components
author: samsze0
summary: Developers want custom components to be able to extend native Streamlit widgets to inherit their styling. This would allow creating custom widgets that look consistent with the core UI.

title: st.page_link should not require http(s) protocol for external links
author: xixixao
summary: `st.page_link` assumes HTTP/HTTPS protocols. Users want support for custom protocols (e.g., `storageexplorer://`) to link to desktop apps or other resources.

title: Adding dynamic, row specific column configuration (data_editor)
author: DirkRemmers
summary: A request for row-specific column configuration in `st.data_editor`. Users want dropdown options in one column to depend on the value selected in another column of the same row.

title: st.fragment breaks sticky positioning of chat input field
author: csipapicsa
summary: Wrapping `st.chat_input` in a fragment breaks its sticky positioning. The input should remain pinned to the bottom regardless of whether it's in a fragment.

title: Disable LaTeX page wide in configuration file to avoid breaking markdown text containing "$"
author: lasseedfast
summary: The `$` character triggers LaTeX rendering in Markdown, breaking text with dollar amounts. Users request a config option to disable LaTeX globally to prevent this.

title: AppTest fails on re-run when an app contains st.pills
author: connortann
summary: `AppTest` fails on the second run if the app contains `st.pills`, throwing a `TypeError`. This indicates a state management bug in the testing framework.

title: Crash while trying to render SVG plots with matplotlib
author: joaoeeq
summary: `st.pyplot(format="svg")` crashes with a PIL error. Streamlit fails to handle SVG data from Matplotlib correctly. Users want SVG support for sharper plots.

title: `st.help` shows `page.run()` header but correct docstring when called in a multipage app
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: `st.help` displays an incorrect header when called inside a multipage app function. The docstring is correct, but the title reflects the execution context instead of the object.

title: Colored Material icons
author: jrieke
summary: Users want to use colored syntax (e.g., `:red[...]`) within `icon` parameters. Currently, this works in Markdown but not in widget icon arguments.

title: Showing the same Plotly chart multiple times leads to `StreamlitDuplicateElementId`
author: jrieke
summary: Displaying the same Plotly figure twice raises a duplicate element ID error. Users expect to be able to reuse figure objects without issues, similar to Altair.

title: Officially support bootstrap.run
author: wobrschalek
summary: A request to officially support `bootstrap.run` for running Streamlit apps from Python scripts. This would facilitate distributing standalone apps.

title: Timeout on Android Chrome Browser for st.file_uploader, cant upload file
author: adamp87
summary: `st.file_uploader` times out on Android Chrome if file selection takes too long. This mobile-specific issue prevents file uploads and needs investigation.

title: Add a menu / dropdown button widget
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request a "dropdown button" widget that combines a button with a menu of actions. This is a standard UI pattern to group related commands.

title: Add support for `kbd` (keyboard) elements in markdown
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request to support `<kbd>` tags in Markdown to render keyboard shortcuts visually. This improves the documentation of app interactions.

title: Support authentication provider icons
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want to use logos of auth providers (Google, etc.) in `icon` parameters. Integration with a library like Simple Icons is suggested for branded buttons.

title: Add an accordion layout container
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for an "accordion" layout container, distinct from `st.expander`, to manage a group of collapsible sections.

title: Cannot use common tenant with microsoft login: authlib.jose.errors.InvalidClaimError: invalid_claim: Invalid claim 'iss'
author: cendrillon
summary: `st.login` fails with `InvalidClaimError` for Microsoft "common" tenant logins. This bug prevents work accounts from authenticating natively.

title: `convert_pandas_df_to_arrow_bytes` can cause unwanted and confusing logging
author: ghilesmeddour
summary: Users want to downgrade INFO logs from `convert_pandas_df_to_arrow_bytes` to DEBUG. These logs are confusing and clutter the console.

title: Allow `st.user` from headers
author: PaleNeutron
summary: Users behind auth proxies want to populate `st.user` from HTTP headers instead of OIDC tokens. This supports alternative authentication architectures.

title: color and background color support for `st.chat_message` avatars
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Users request parameters to customize the background and text color of `st.chat_message` avatars. This improves visual distinction between chat participants.

title: Bug st.toast breaks the app when executed from a callback
author: injeniero
summary: Triggering `st.toast` from a callback within `st.dialog` crashes the app. The nesting of these components causes a frontend error that needs fixing.

title: You should install Authlib for me
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: `st.login` requires `Authlib` but doesn't install it. Users suggest adding it as a dependency or extra to simplify the getting started experience.

title: Support widget pills in the class AppTest
author: borahntarridec
summary: A request to add `st.pills` support to `AppTest`. This would allow automated testing of apps using this widget.

title: Multiple `st.audio` calls with same parameters and autoplay=True raises DuplicateWidget error, prompts you to add a key, but you can't add a key
author: sfc-gh-zblackwood
summary: Using `st.audio` multiple times with `autoplay=True` causes duplicate ID errors. A `key` parameter or better ID generation is needed to support this use case.

title: Disable copying data from a dataframe
author: thisisbhupendrasingh
summary: Enterprise users want to disable "copy" and "download" actions in `st.dataframe` to prevent data exfiltration. Parameters to control these features are requested.

title: Multiselect drop down background is inconsistent
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: `st.multiselect` background colors are inconsistent in the sidebar when using custom themes. The sidebar should inherit theme settings consistently.

title: Tick styling inconsistent in `st.bokeh_chart()` vs `streamlit_bokeh()` for caliber theme
author: pr3d4t0r
labels: type:bug, good first issue, area:styling, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.bokeh_chart, upstream
summary: `streamlit_bokeh` fails to render ticks correctly with the "caliber" theme. This regression affects chart styling and needs a fix.

title: Custom components rendered in non-active tabs rendered with height of 0
author: Abdur-Rahim-sheikh
summary: Custom components in non-active tabs render with zero height or crash. This issue prevents using components in multi-tab layouts.

title: Segmented control fails with type error in AppTest
author: thorin-schiffer
summary: `st.segmented_control` throws errors in `AppTest` due to internal state issues. A fix is needed to allow testing this widget.

title: MCP server for streamlit
author: subham-padhi-01
summary: A request to build an MCP server for Streamlit to integrate with AI assistants like Claude for on-the-fly visualization generation.

title: Passing 0 to specific a dynamic port incorrectly prints Local URL: http://localhost:0 to the console
author: hellovolcano
summary: Starting Streamlit with port 0 logs `http://localhost:0` instead of the actual port. The console output should reflect the assigned dynamic port.

title: Rerun when `config.toml` is created
author: jrieke
summary: Streamlit should automatically rerun when a `config.toml` file is created, similar to how it handles updates. Currently, a restart is required.

title: Monitor streamlit app resources
author: pclp007
summary: Users request built-in resource monitoring (RAM, CPU) for Streamlit apps. This would help developers debug performance bottlenecks.

title: [Coming soon] Persist widget identity when key is set, even if the parameters change
author: jrieke
summary: Users want widget state to persist based on `key` even if parameters change. Currently, parameter updates reset the widget, losing user input.

title: Plotly bar graph point selection giving wrong values for x and label
author: dcoe-jkpaper
summary: Selecting points on grouped Plotly charts returns incorrect data. This bug affects the interactivity of grouped bar charts.

title: Add ability to remove link to Google and ChatGPT for Exception, even when using Localhost (#11021)
author: carlosicc
summary: Enterprise users want to disable external links (Google/ChatGPT) in exception dialogs for security. A config option is requested.

title: allow any element to be programatically 'focus'ed based on its key/id
author: sammlapp
summary: A request for a method to programmatically focus widgets (e.g., `st.focus(key)`). This improves accessibility and data entry workflows.

title: support for custom keyboard navigation in streamlit apps
author: madhukarjadhav736
summary: Users want custom keyboard shortcuts, like "Enter" to navigate fields. This is critical for high-speed data entry apps.

title: Disable Column Drag and Drop in data_editor and dataframe
author: Andrew-DeCandia-Volpe
summary: Users want to disable column reordering in `st.dataframe`. A `lock_columns` parameter would ensure fixed layouts.

title: `st.multiselect` (and `st.selectbox`) no longer supports repeated labels in `options`
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: `st.multiselect` no longer supports duplicate option labels. Users need this for lists where identical names map to different IDs.

title: Allow st.dataframe to act as an input widget inside a form
author: brg05
summary: `st.dataframe` selections don't work inside `st.form`. Users want dataframes to act as form inputs that submit their state.

title: container width parameter for st.toggle
author: madhukarjadhav736
summary: Users request `use_container_width` for `st.toggle` to align it better with other full-width widgets.

title: Allow multi-level headers in st.data_editor
author: DirkRemmers
summary: A request for multi-level header support in `st.data_editor`, mirroring the capability in `st.dataframe`.

title: plotly_chart fullscreen with image shrinks plot
author: MadameMinty
summary: Fullscreen mode shrinks Plotly charts containing images. This bug degrades the viewing experience for image-heavy plots.

title: Streamlit is written the way all software should be written.
author: Tylersuard
summary: A user kudos for Streamlit's simplicity and developer experience.

title: Support inserting 'localized' format in data-editor
author: Brombeertje69
summary: Pasting numbers into `st.data_editor` fails to respect localized formats (e.g., commas). The editor should parse pasted data according to locale.

title: Play/pause `st.audio` via keyboard
author: sammlapp
summary: A request for programmatic play/pause control for `st.audio` to enable keyboard shortcuts for media playback.

title: `cache_data` cannot detect difference in values of free variables, or 2 inner functions with identical __qualname__
author: jokester
summary: `st.cache_data` fails to detect changes in captured variables within closures. This leads to stale cache results.

title: Support ArcGIS maps
author: sfc-gh-jrieke
summary: A request to support ArcGIS maps in Streamlit via a native command.

title: segmented_control: specify color for each element
author: sammlapp
summary: Users want to color individual options in `st.segmented_control` to distinguish choices like "Yes"/"No".

title: Add ability to auto instrument streamlit backend and frontend with DataDog
author: RyPeck
summary: A request for native DataDog auto-instrumentation to monitor frontend and backend performance.

title: Inconsistent and confusing `None` representation in `st.dataframe`
author: ghilesmeddour
summary: `st.dataframe` inconsistently displays `None` values. Users want a standardized representation for nulls.

title: Make the `MAX_APP_STATIC_FOLDER_SIZE` configurable
author: MrCsabaToth
summary: Users request a configurable limit for the static folder size to support apps serving larger assets.

title: session_state not preserved when using st.switch_page
author: drew-wks
summary: `st.switch_page` causes `st.session_state` loss, unlike `st.page_link`. Navigation methods should have consistent state preservation.

title: Streamlit fails to raise an error when modifying non-fragment widget values in a fragment rerun
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Modifying non-fragment state during a fragment rerun fails silently. Streamlit should warn or error on this invalid pattern.

title: Feature Request: Dual-LLM Chatbot Output with Voting Option in chatbot module
author: QuentinFuxa
summary: A request for a dual-chat UI component for LLM A/B testing and evaluation.

title: Grid layout
author: jrieke
summary: Users request a native `st.grid` layout for complex dashboards, offering more control than columns.

title: Customize the blinking cursor in `st.write_stream`
author: jrieke
summary: Users want to customize the blinking cursor character in `st.write_stream` to match other chat UIs.

title: st.chat_input uploading unsupported files does not prevent sending message
author: ayseozgun
summary: `st.chat_input` should block submission if an unsupported file is attached. Currently, it warns but allows sending.

title: Put `None`'s at bottom when sorting dataframe columns with `None` values
author: MaxSchambach
summary: Users want to configure sort behavior for `None` values in dataframes, specifically to keep them at the bottom.

title: st.form, pressing 'Enter' keyboard button should auto focus to next input field
author: drmaddy736
summary: A request for "Enter" key navigation between form fields to speed up data entry.

title: Logo link (st.logo) always opens in new tab (target="_blank"), need option to open in same tab
author: makboc
summary: Users want `st.logo` links to open in the same tab optionally, instead of forcing a new tab.

title: OpenAI responses API support for write_stream
author: smurching
summary: A request for first-class support of OpenAI's `responses` API in `st.write_stream`.

title: Disable st.data_editor by cell (and row): cell/row-level editability
author: dr-jpk-be
summary: Users request cell-level or row-level editability controls in `st.data_editor` for conditional logic.

title: Add the ability to initialize the cache (and orchestrate its refreshment)
author: ghilesmeddour
summary: A request for cache orchestration features, allowing background refresh and pre-warming.

title: Allow `MAX_APP_STATIC_FILE_SIZE` to be configurable
author: guoci
summary: The `MAX_APP_STATIC_FILE_SIZE` is hardcoded to 200MB, causing 404 errors for larger files. Users request a configuration option to adjust this limit. This is critical for apps serving large scientific datasets or media.

title: Watch changes in uv workspaces
author: NixBiks
summary: Streamlit's file watcher doesn't detect changes in `uv` workspaces modules, breaking hot reload for this project structure. Users want support for watching changes in local dependencies managed by `uv`.

title: st.plotly_chart ignores font_family and font_color in fig.update_layout for Sankey diagrams, but fig.show() renders correctly
author: jjaviergalvez
summary: `st.plotly_chart` ignores `font_family` and `font_color` settings in Sankey diagrams, even though `fig.show()` renders them correctly. Only `font_size` works. This inconsistency suggests a bug in how Streamlit serializes or renders specific Plotly chart attributes.

title: Clicking a button in a fragment doesn't interrupt the fragment to immediately rerun.
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Clicking a button inside a fragment fails to interrupt the fragment's execution or trigger an immediate rerun. The fragment continues running to completion. Users expect interactions to interrupt execution immediately, similar to the main script behavior.

title: Add draw.io support
author: WhippingBoy01
summary: A request to add support for Draw.io diagrams in Streamlit. This would allow users to create or view diagrams within the app.

title: Change the background color of dataframe cells
author: jrieke
summary: Users want a built-in way to set the background color of `st.dataframe` cells without using the slow Pandas Styler. This includes setting colors for specific cells or conditional formatting based on values (e.g., heatmaps).

title: Add minimap to built-in charts
author: jrieke
summary: A request to add a minimap feature to built-in charts (`st.line_chart`, etc.). This helps users navigate large datasets within a chart. It's a standard feature in libraries like Altair that users want exposed natively.

title: Preserve session state (e.g. in file, database, or localstorage)
author: jrieke
summary: Users request a mechanism to persist `st.session_state` across browser sessions (e.g., via local storage, file, or database). This would allow users to close a tab and resume their work later without losing input data.

title: v1.44.0/1 significant slower and also shows weird behavior with multi-page app
author: dirkliebich
summary: A user reports significant performance degradation and "Page not found" errors after upgrading to Streamlit 1.44. Sidebar loading is flicker-heavy. This seems to be a regression affecting multipage apps and navigation speed.

title: More `st.column_config` types: slider, select slider, and segmented control
author: Yves33
summary: `st.column_config` lacks column types for interactive widgets like sliders, toggles, and segmented controls. Users want to use these input types directly within `st.data_editor` for a better mobile editing experience.

title: Show alternative `st.toggle` label based on its state
author: Yves33
summary: `st.toggle` labels are static. Users request the ability to show different labels based on the toggle's state (on/off). This would allow for more expressive UI elements, like "Show details" switching to "Hide details".

title: BaseComponentRegistry.register_component should have access to the session ID or session context
author: sfc-gh-jkinkead
summary: Custom component registration (`register_component`) lacks access to the current session context. Developers need this to track per-session metadata for components. The request is to expose session info during component registration.

title: BaseComponentRegistry does not provide a mechanism for transforming components from path-based to url-based (or vice-versa)
author: sfc-gh-jkinkead
summary: The `BaseComponentRegistry` API does not allow transforming components from path-based to URL-based dynamically. This limitation hinders advanced component serving strategies. A return value for `register_component` is proposed to allow substitution.

title: Make screen size available in `st.context`
author: jrieke
summary: Users request screen dimensions (`screen_width`, `screen_height`) in `st.context` to build responsive UIs in Python. While Streamlit is responsive, some layout decisions require explicit knowledge of the device size (mobile vs. desktop).

title: time_input does not keep the entered value when tabbing out of it
author: pkunze
summary: Tabbing out of an `st.time_input` field after typing a value resets it to the previous state instead of committing the change. This usability bug frustrates keyboard users. The expected behavior is for the input to accept the typed value on blur.

title: TypeError: unhashable type: 'list' when a Pandas DataFrame contains a list using st.cache
author: staticf0x
summary: `st.cache_data` raises a `TypeError: unhashable type: 'list'` when a cached function returns a DataFrame containing lists, and that result is passed to another cached function. This regression in version 1.43 breaks caching pipelines involving complex DataFrames.

title: Enable formatting/styling of editable columns in st.data_editor
author: dr-jpk-be
summary: `st.data_editor` allows styling disabled columns but not editable ones. Users want to apply conditional formatting (colors, bold text) to editable cells as well. This is needed to highlight inputs or specific data states in the editor.

title: Low rendering performance of st.data_editor and st.dataframe for formatted columns (via pandas styler)
author: dr-jpk-be
summary: Using Pandas Styler with `st.data_editor` causes severe performance issues for larger dataframes (hundreds of rows). Rendering becomes laggy. Users request a more performant styling mechanism that doesn't degrade the app experience.

title: Add use_container_width to configuration file options
author: rsheftel
summary: Recent changes made `use_container_width=True` the default for charts and dataframes. This broke layout for many existing apps. Users request a config option to set the global default for this parameter to `False` to preserve their designs.

title: Improve handling of dataframes with duplicate column names
author: lukasmasuch
summary: `st.dataframe` should handle duplicate column names gracefully. Currently, duplicates can cause issues in display or processing. The suggestion is to auto-rename duplicates or handle them robustly in the frontend.

title: `st.dialog` shows stale elements from previous dialog
author: jrieke
summary: Opening a second `st.dialog` after closing the first one momentarily shows stale content from the first dialog. This visual glitch happens if the second dialog takes time to load. The dialog content should be cleared upon closure.

title: Revamp HTML validation error popup
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, area:widgets, feature:st.number_input
summary: Validation errors in widgets like `st.number_input` currently use the default browser HTML error bubble. The request is to style these validation messages using Streamlit's own UI components for consistency and theming support.

title: `icon` parameters should accept Emoji shortcodes
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, feature:multipage-apps, feature:st.download_button, feature:st.set_page_config, feature:st.info, feature:st.button, feature:st.chat_message, feature:st.link_button, feature:st.form_submit_button, feature:st.success, feature:st.warning, feature:st.error, feature:st.badge
summary: `icon` parameters accept emojis and Material icons but not emoji shortcodes (e.g., `:warning:`). Users want support for shortcodes for convenience and consistency with Markdown.

title: Make `st.warning` etc pick up icons at the beginning of the text
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.info, feature:st.success, feature:st.warning
summary: Alert elements (`st.warning`, etc.) should automatically detect and format emojis placed at the start of the text as icons. Currently, they render as plain text unless passed to the `icon` parameter. This would simplify usage.

title: implement Backdrop component to block user interaction before some long tasks are finished
author: link89
summary: A request for a "Backdrop" component or option to block user interaction during long-running tasks. This overlay would prevent users from clicking other widgets while a process completes, a common UX pattern for preventing race conditions.

title: `st.dataframe` displays wrong indizes for pivoted dataframe
author: punsii
labels: type:bug, feature:st.dataframe, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.data_editor, upstream
summary: `st.dataframe` displays incorrect indices for pivoted or multi-indexed dataframes under certain conditions. It duplicates index labels incorrectly. This is a bug in how the dataframe renders complex index structures.

title: Allow HTML in `st.dataframe`
author: jrieke
summary: Users request support for rendering raw HTML inside `st.dataframe` cells, similar to `st.markdown(unsafe_allow_html=True)`. This would enable rich content formatting within tables.

title: Add QR code for Network URL access in Streamlit app launch message
author: ksp2000
summary: When launching an app, Streamlit prints the network URL. Users suggest also displaying a QR code in the terminal to allow easy access from mobile devices on the same network. This is a convenience feature found in other dev tools like Vite.

title: Infer page title and favicon from `st.title` instead of requiring `st.set_page_config`
author: jrieke
summary: Streamlit defaults to "Streamlit" as the page title. The proposal is to infer the page title and favicon from the first `st.title` call if `st.set_page_config` is not used. This would provide better defaults without extra boilerplate code.

title: Enable "Download as CSV" for large dataframes
author: ghilesmeddour
summary: The "Download as CSV" option in `st.dataframe` toolbar does not appear for large dataframes (e.g., >100k rows). Users want this feature enabled for larger datasets as well.

title: Make ODBC Driver 18 for SQL Server available in Community Cloud
author: philipnye
summary: The Streamlit Community Cloud includes an outdated ODBC Driver 17 for SQL Server. Users request an update to version 18 to support newer features and match local development environments.

title: HTTPS Production Environment Support
author: OwenRicker
summary: Users want official, production-ready HTTPS support in Streamlit's internal server. Currently, the docs advise against using the built-in SSL for production. Users want this hardened so they don't have to set up a reverse proxy like Nginx.

title: Add examples to `st.file_uploader`
author: jrieke
summary: A request to allow providing example files in `st.file_uploader`. Users could click an example to "upload" it instantly for testing the app. This improves the demo experience for apps requiring specific file inputs.

title: Add `default` parameter to `st.file_uploader`
author: jrieke
summary: Similar to the above, users want a `default` parameter for `st.file_uploader` to pre-load a file from the local system. This allows the app to start with valid data populated.

title: Upload files to disk with `st.file_uploader`
author: jrieke
summary: Users want to upload files directly to disk with `st.file_uploader` to avoid memory limits. This is crucial for handling very large files that exceed server RAM.

title: Upload files to S3 with `st.file_uploader`
author: jrieke
summary: A request to upload files directly to S3 (or other storage) from `st.file_uploader`, bypassing the app server's memory and disk. This supports scalable file handling for large uploads.

title: Allow changing `st.dataframe` row height from the UI
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want to adjust the row height of `st.dataframe` interactively via the UI toolbar. This allows users to switch between compact and comfortable views dynamically.

title: Add `width` & `height` support to `st.table`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: `st.table` forces all rows to render, which is problematic for large tables. Users request `width` and `height` parameters to enable scrolling for `st.table`, making it usable for larger datasets while retaining its styling.

title: Add a json editor widget
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for a JSON editor widget. `st.json` is read-only; users want to be able to edit JSON structures directly in the app.

title: Add a checkbox group widget
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request a `checkbox_group` widget to create a group of checkboxes with a single command, similar to `st.radio`. This simplifies code for multiple binary options.

title: Streamlit cloud app does not stay awake on repo commits
author: metalshanked
summary: A user reports that their Community Cloud app goes to sleep despite frequent commits to the repo. The documentation states commits should keep it awake. This indicates a potential issue with the wake-on-commit logic.

title: Widget state is not persisted after adding run_every to a fragment
author: OSalama
summary: Adding `run_every` to a fragment causes widget state to reset unexpectedly when navigating between pages. The state should persist, but the periodic rerun seems to interfere with state preservation during navigation.

title: Redirect all console print to log
author: redfave
summary: Streamlit does not capture all console output (like startup logs) in the logger. Users want a way to redirect *all* stdout/stderr to a log file for comprehensive debugging and traceability in production.

title: Enable sorting on `st.data_editor` if `num_rows="dynamic"`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Sorting is disabled in `st.data_editor` when `num_rows="dynamic"`. Users want to enable sorting even when dynamic row addition is allowed. The limitation exists due to technical complexity but is a desired feature.

title: Add a pagination widget
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for a pagination widget (`st.paginator`) to split content into multiple pages. This is a standard UI pattern for handling large lists of items.

title: Be able to deselect an `st.radio` when `index=None`
author: VERBOSE-01
summary: `st.radio` can be initialized with no selection (`index=None`), but once a user selects an option, they cannot deselect it to return to the "None" state. Users want a way to uncheck a radio button.

title: Support `use_container_width=False` in `st.table()`
author: JosephMarinier
summary: Users want `st.table` to support `use_container_width=False`, similar to `st.dataframe`. This allows tables to take up only their natural width instead of stretching.

title: Left aligned buttons
author: sfc-gh-amiribel
summary: A request to support left alignment for buttons. Currently, buttons are center or right aligned (implied default behavior often fills width or centers). Left alignment is desired for sidebar navigation and other layouts.

title: Support `background` CSS property in `st.dataframe()` (for `df.style.bar()`)
author: JosephMarinier
summary: `st.dataframe` supports `background-color` styling but not the generic `background` property (e.g., for gradients or images). Users want full support for `background` CSS via Pandas Styler to enable features like bar charts within cells.

title: Option to use full screen for st.popover with popdown button
author: drmaddy736
summary: Users request a full-screen option for `st.popover`. This would be useful for displaying large content like dataframes in a focused view.

title: Horizontal scroll for st.popover
author: drmaddy736
summary: `st.popover` content does not scroll horizontally if it overflows. Users want horizontal scrolling enabled to handle wide content like large dataframes.

title: Custom components unmount and reload on switch_page
author: vquilon
summary: Custom components glitch (unmount/remount) when using `st.switch_page` or custom navigation. Users want persistent custom components that don't reload during page transitions to maintain state and smooth UX.

title: Support admonitions / alerts / callouts in markdown
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request to support Markdown admonitions (alerts/callouts) using standard syntax like `> [!NOTE]` or `:::note`. This allows for rich text formatting of alerts within Markdown blocks.

title: Support expandable blocks in markdown
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want support for collapsible details blocks (`<details>`) in Markdown. This allows hiding content behind a toggle directly within text blocks.

title: Allow changing theming aspects for specific elements (stylable container)
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want to apply theme overrides to specific containers or elements. This would allow styling a specific section (e.g., a "dark" card in a "light" app) without global theme changes.

title: Add a stepper widget
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for a "Stepper" widget to visualize progress through a multi-step workflow. This is a common UI pattern for wizards and guides.

title: Add support for Jupyter widgets / ipywidgets
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want support for `ipywidgets` (Jupyter widgets) in Streamlit. This would unlock a vast ecosystem of existing interactive widgets.

title: Add support for using anywidget elements
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Similar to the above, users want support for `anywidget` components. This is a modern standard for portable widgets that works across notebook environments and would benefit Streamlit.

title: Support masked input in `st.text_input`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for masked text input (e.g., for phone numbers or dates). This enforces input formatting and improves data quality.

title: Add an optimized search input widget
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request a specialized search input widget with features like a search icon, clear button, and autocomplete. This serves a specific and common UI need better than a generic text input.

title: Add download action to `st.image` toolbar
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request to add a download button to the `st.image` toolbar. This allows users to easily save images displayed in the app.

title: Allow selection of arbitrary points on the map for `st.pydeck_chart`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want to select arbitrary points on a map in `st.pydeck_chart` and get the coordinates back. Currently, only object selection is supported.

title: Allow to add, delete and rename dataframe columns in `st.data_editor`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: `st.data_editor` allows adding/deleting rows. Users want similar functionality for columns: adding, deleting, and renaming columns interactively.

title: Add a configurable toolbar or clickable actions to `st.chat_message`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request to add configurable toolbar actions to `st.chat_message`. This would allow features like "Copy", "Regenerate", or "Feedback" buttons directly on chat bubbles.

title: Support a collapsed page navigation menu that only shows the page icons
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want a collapsed navigation rail mode that shows only page icons (like the VS Code activity bar). This saves space while keeping navigation accessible.

title: Add a page without showing it in the navigation menu
author: lukasmasuch
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:multipage-apps, feature:st.navigation
summary: A request to create "hidden" pages that exist at a URL but do not appear in the sidebar navigation menu. This allows for deep linking to utility pages without cluttering the nav.

title: Add configurable buttons into `st.chat_input`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want to add configurable buttons/toggles inside the `st.chat_input` area (e.g., for "Web Search" or "Reasoning" toggles). This mimics the UI of advanced LLM interfaces.

title: Support multi-column sort for `st.dataframe`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: `st.dataframe` only supports single-column sorting. Users want multi-column sort capabilities (e.g., Sort by A, then by B) for better data exploration.

title: Support setting `label` and `help` for charts and dataframe
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request to add `label` and `help` parameters to chart and dataframe elements. This standardizes the API and provides a consistent way to label and explain complex visualizations.

title: Configure the height of `st.chat_input`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users want to configure the initial height of `st.chat_input`. This allows for larger text entry areas by default, similar to modern AI chat apps.

title: Add a bottom layout container
author: lukasmasuch
summary: A request for a `st.bottom` container that is pinned to the bottom of the main area (distinct from the sidebar). This allows for sticky footers or chat inputs with adjacent controls.

title: Add support for mermaid charts
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request native support for rendering Mermaid diagrams. This text-to-diagram tool is popular in documentation and would be valuable for visualizing flows in apps.

title: Nested periodic st.fragments can cause StreamlitDuplicateElementId
author: schaumb
summary: Nested `st.fragment` elements with periodic reruns (`run_every`) can cause a `StreamlitDuplicateElementId` error. This happens when intervals align and cause simultaneous updates. The runtime needs to handle nested concurrent fragment updates safely.

title: New client_kwargs entry (acr_values) is not accepted, auth fails in st.login()
author: guntukaramakrishna
summary: `st.login` fails when extra parameters like `acr_values` are passed in `client_kwargs`. The auth library seems to reject or mishandle these custom parameters, preventing login for some enterprise configurations.

title: Preserve Selection, Sorting and Scrolling Position in st.dataframe
author: miketech
summary: `st.dataframe` loses selection, sorting, and scroll position on reruns. Users want this state to persist to allow for master-detail workflows where the table doesn't reset after interaction.

title: Clickable Container
author: alex-bork
summary: Users request the ability to make an entire `st.container` clickable via an `on_click` event. This allows creating clickable cards or tiles.

title: Floating action button
author: jrieke
summary: A request for a Floating Action Button (FAB) widget. This standard UI element is useful for primary actions like "New Chat" or "Add Item".

title: Preserve `st.column_config.Column` visibility restrictions in the UI
author: VERBOSE-01
summary: `st.data_editor` allows hiding columns via config, but users can unhide them via the new UI visibility menu. Developers want to enforce visibility restrictions so users cannot reveal hidden columns.

title: Row hover effect in `st.dataframe` is barely visible
author: VERBOSE-01
summary: The hover row effect in `st.dataframe` is too subtle. Users want it to be more visible or customizable.

title: Rerun fragment from anywhere, not just from within itself
author: Abdelgha-4
summary: A request to trigger a fragment rerun from outside the fragment itself. Currently, fragments can only rerun themselves. External triggers would allow for dependency-based updates.

title: Input events immediately terminate everything?
author: ConcurrentCrab
summary: Triggering an input event seems to immediately terminate the current script run, causing issues with generators or async tasks that are mid-execution. Users want a way to handle inputs gracefully without hard termination of ongoing logic.

title: streamlet-bokeh missing Python3.9 support due to bokeh3 version
author: SimonHeim
summary: `streamlit-bokeh` dropped support for Python 3.9 by pinning a newer Bokeh version. Users on Python 3.9 request support, possibly by allowing an older Bokeh version.

title: `st.page_link` and `st.switch_page` don't raise errors when pointing to non-existent pages with the same pathname as a real page
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
labels: type:bug, status:confirmed, priority:P4, feature:st.switch_page, feature:st.page_link, feature:st.navigation
summary: `st.page_link` silently redirects to an existing page if a non-existent page with a matching URL path is provided. It should raise an error instead of guessing.

title: For consistency, let `st.page_link` and `st.switch_page` accept callable
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: `st.page_link` and `st.switch_page` should accept callable page functions, just like `st.navigation` does. This improves API consistency.

title: Add support for rendering html in `st.table` cells
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Users request `unsafe_allow_html=True` for `st.table` to render HTML content within cells. This allows for rich formatting in static tables.

title: Discrepancy of selectbox value in AppTest
author: ams1
summary: `AppTest` returns the label string instead of the value dictionary for `st.selectbox` when using `format_func`. This discrepancy breaks tests that rely on the actual object value.

title: Set `[auth]` secrets config from environment variables or through `st.login`
author: Riezebos
summary: Users want to configure `st.login` secrets via environment variables or arguments, not just `secrets.toml`. This supports diverse deployment and secret management strategies.

title: Make `OAUTH2_CALLBACK_ENDPOINT` in `streamlit.web.server.server` configurable
author: Riezebos
summary: The OAuth callback endpoint is hardcoded. Users request a config option to customize it (e.g., `/oauth/callback`) to match their infrastructure requirements.

title: Background color for `st.container`
author: jrieke
summary: A request to set a background color for `st.container`. This allows creating visual sections or cards with distinct backgrounds.

title: Slow download of csv file when using the inbuild download as csv function for tables displayed as dataframes in Edge Browser
author: LazerLars
labels: type:bug, area:windows, feature:st.dataframe, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.download_button, feature:st.data_editor
summary: Downloading CSVs from `st.dataframe` is extremely slow in Edge browser. Users report significantly faster downloads with custom buttons. This performance issue needs investigation.

title: Programmatically update multiselect selected values
author: MaxMargolis
summary: Users want to programmatically update the selected values of `st.multiselect` after initialization. Currently, updating the state is difficult or limited.

title: unicode error
author: madhukarjadhav736
summary: A Unicode error occurs when importing certain modules (like `heyoo`) in Streamlit 1.40 on Windows. This seems to be a regression in how Streamlit handles script execution and encoding.

title: st.rerun in callback in fragment
author: msquaredds
summary: Calling `st.rerun()` inside a callback within a fragment only reruns the fragment. Users want an option to force a full page rerun from a fragment callback.

title: More advanced text display extensions
author: lix8886
summary: Users are excited about potential new text display extensions (attachments) shown in a screenshot and want this feature implemented.

title: Add `run_every` to `st.set_page_config`
author: jrieke
summary: Users request a `run_every` parameter in `st.set_page_config` to trigger full app auto-refreshes. This would replace third-party hacks for auto-refreshing dashboards.

title: Make sidebar allowable in fragment?
author: msquaredds
summary: Users want to define sidebar elements inside a fragment. This would allow updating sidebar controls without rerunning the main page content.

title: Add `st.pie_chart`
author: paulocoutinhox
summary: A request for a native `st.pie_chart` command. While pie charts are controversial, they are frequently requested for simple part-to-whole visualizations.

title: Add support for more currency formats to `column_config.NumberColumn`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: `NumberColumn` supports limited currency formats. Users request support for all currencies available in the Intl.NumberFormat API for better internationalization.

title: Default `set_page_config` through `.streamlit/config.toml`
author: pallagj
summary: Streamlit shows default branding before `st.set_page_config` runs. Users want to define page title and icon in `config.toml` so the app loads with correct branding immediately.

title: Streamlit app not able to be fully processed by capture / screenshot feature of Browsers
author: redfave
summary: Browser screenshots of Streamlit apps often fail to capture the full scrolling page, capturing only the viewport. This seems to be an issue with how Streamlit handles scrolling layout. Users want full-page screenshots to work.

title: Pinned columns (column config) do not work when hide_index=True
author: nickgreengithub
summary: Pinned columns in `st.column_config` fail to remain pinned if `hide_index=True` is set. Users expect the pinning behavior to persist for data columns regardless of the index visibility.

title: Possibility of a hub/server for all Streamlit apps created
author: FerriLuli
summary: A request for a built-in "Hub" or "Server" mode to host and organize multiple Streamlit apps centrally. This would include a landing page and potentially shared authentication for a suite of apps.

title: [Coming soon] Option to Return Access Token in st.login
author: Panosero
summary: The `st.login` command does not expose the OAuth access token or refresh capabilities. Developers need access to these tokens to make authenticated API calls to third-party services on behalf of the user.

title: Inline code replaces / with _ sometimes
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: Inline code blocks in Markdown that start and end with `:` (e.g., for emoji shortcodes) incorrectly replace `/` characters with `_`. This breaks rendering of Material icon shortcodes within code blocks.

title: Support .env files for configuration
author: str00bs
summary: Streamlit ignores configuration set via environment variables or `.env` files in certain contexts, reverting to defaults. Users expect standard environment variable configuration precedence to be respected.

title: Support implementing a method on a class to make it hashable for caching
author: BartSchuurmans
summary: A request to support a custom method (e.g., `__streamlit_hash__`) on classes to define their hashing logic for `st.cache_data`. This would avoid the need to repeatedly pass `hash_funcs` for custom types.

title: altair.selection_point value ignored in st.altair_chart if on_select="rerun"
author: kopp
summary: In `st.altair_chart`, the default value of an `altair.selection_point` is ignored if `on_select="rerun"` is enabled. The chart should respect the pre-selected value defined in the Altair spec.

title: Support copy/pasting files into `st.chat_input`
author: sfc-gh-jrieke
summary: Users want the ability to copy and paste files directly into the `st.chat_input` widget for uploading, streamlining the workflow for attaching images or documents in chat interfaces.

title: Does not show an SVG image in the ImageColumn
author: AMSolin
summary: `st.column_config.ImageColumn` fails to render SVG images, while `st.image` handles them correctly. Users expect consistent image format support across all image-displaying components.

title: Add Bluesky to the social sharing menu
author: marijane
summary: A request to add Bluesky to the list of social media platforms in the Streamlit app sharing menu, acknowledging its growing user base in the data community.

title: When st.dialog is run in fragment, not possible to open again when clicked outside modal/area when event running in dialog.
author: Socvest
summary: `st.dialog` behaves inconsistently when used inside a fragment. specifically, clicking outside to dismiss and then trying to reopen it fails if an event loop is active, unlike when used globally.

title: Chart builder
author: dmslowmo
summary: A feature request for a native "Chart Builder" UI component. This would allow end-users to interactively create and customize charts without writing code, lowering the barrier to entry.

title: Dynamic popover height
author: taugustinov-ness
summary: `st.popover` does not dynamically adjust its height when internal content (like a dropdown) expands. This causes content to be cut off. Users want the popover to resize to fit its active content.

title: Page Refresh detection and data persistance between refresh page
author: learncodingforweb
summary: Users request a way to detect browser page refreshes and persist specific resource connections (like serial ports) across them. Currently, refreshes reset the app state completely.

title: Update st.context.headers after a certain amount of time
author: buenavista62
summary: `st.context.headers` are captured only at startup and do not update. Users need a way to refresh these headers (e.g., for updated auth tokens) during a long-running session without reloading the page.

title: Capturing events from interactive plotly line drawing
author: CarlAndersson
summary: A request to expose events from interactive Plotly line drawing tools (e.g., `drawopenpath`) to Streamlit. This would allow capturing coordinates of user-drawn shapes on charts.

title: Change browser url path when click pages of streamlit app embedded by iframe
author: PaleNeutron
summary: When Streamlit is embedded in an iframe, navigating pages does not update the parent browser URL. Users want an option to sync the URL to enable deep linking to specific pages within the embed.

title: Dataframe row click events
author: bakkiaraj
summary: Clicking a dataframe row to open a dialog that triggers `st.rerun` causes an infinite loop. The selection event seems to persist or re-trigger inappropriately during the rerun cycle.

title: Provide a new dataframe column type to insert Markdown text
author: bakkiaraj
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.dataframe, feature:st.data_editor, feature:st.column_config
summary: A request for a `MarkdownColumn` in `st.dataframe` to render Markdown formatted text within table cells. Current text columns do not support rich formatting.

title: Visual issue in selectbox dropdown with scrollbar
author: jrieke
labels: type:bug, status:confirmed, priority:P4, feature:st.selectbox, feature:st.time_input, feature:st.multiselect
summary: Visual bug in `st.selectbox` (and other dropdowns) where the gray hover background effect stops short of the scrollbar, creating an unpolished look when scrolling is active.

title: Page Reload on Cache Miss
author: stefanadelbert
summary: When multiple cached functions expire at once, triggering a rerun causes the page to reload and scroll to the top, disrupting the user experience. State should be preserved smoothly during cache refreshes.

title: Click (not selection) events for dataframes, charts, and maps
author: jrieke
labels: type:enhancement, feature:st.dataframe, feature:st.altair_chart, feature:st.plotly_chart, feature:st.pydeck_chart, area:events
summary: Request for a stateless "click" event for charts and dataframes, separate from stateful "selection". This would allow using chart clicks as triggers for one-off actions like opening a dialog.

title: `st.data_editor` does not persist scroll position (x,y) after on_change refresh, when dependent/virtual columns are also updated
author: mariod13
summary: `st.data_editor` resets the scroll position to the top-left after an edit if the dataframe is updated (e.g., dependent columns). Users want the editor to maintain the scroll position to allow continuous editing.

title: Pending changes to a widget are not submitted if interrupted by `st.rerun()` or `st.switch_page()`.
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Pending widget edits are lost if the app is programmatically rerun (`st.rerun` or `st.switch_page`) before the user commits the change. The frontend retains the value, but the backend does not receive it, causing a state mismatch.

title: Redirect to last viewed page in multipage app after `st.login`
author: jrieke
summary: `st.login` redirects users to the main page after authentication. Users expect to be redirected back to the specific page they were viewing before the login flow started.

title: Configure the cookie expiration time for authentication
author: jrieke
summary: A request to configure the expiration time (TTL) for the authentication cookie set by `st.login`. This would allow developers to control how often users need to re-authenticate.

title: Expose OAuth errors during `st.login`
author: jrieke
summary: Errors during the OAuth flow (e.g., user cancellation) are not exposed to the developer. Users want a way to handle these errors programmatically or have Streamlit show a UI notification.

title: Make dataframe search filter the rows, instead of jumping to the result
author: jrieke
summary: Feature request for `st.dataframe` search to optionally filter the visible rows to show only matches, rather than just highlighting/jumping to them. This mimics behavior in tools like Notion.

title: streamlit should by default only bind to localhost [SECURE BY DEFAULT ❤️]
author: basFriday
summary: Security enhancement request: Streamlit should bind to `localhost` by default in development mode instead of `0.0.0.0`, to prevent accidental exposure on public networks.

title: Show table with merged cells
author: mtst238
summary: A request to support merged cells in `st.dataframe` or `st.table`. This is needed for displaying complex headers or grouped data in a readable table format.

title: Pre set selections for `st.dataframe`
author: StarDustEins
summary: Users want to programmatically set the selection state of `st.dataframe` or `st.data_editor`. Currently, selection is read-only from the user's perspective.

title: `st.close()` or `st.end()` to close or mark the end of a container and remove stale elements (like a frontend version of `st.stop()`)
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Request for a command (`st.close()` or similar) to mark the end of a container's content stream and immediately remove any subsequent stale elements, improving cleanup for streaming apps.

title: Fullscreen label for `st.image`
author: Walter909
summary: Users want to add a label or description to `st.image` that appears when the image is viewed in fullscreen mode, providing context for gallery images.

title: Input widget does not take input from password manager
author: sandervdhimst
summary: Input widgets do not detect values autofilled by password managers (like Dashlane). The `on_change` callback is not triggered, and session state is not updated until manual interaction occurs.

title: on_change callback is triggered without user-interaction on in-script delays
author: MaxvandenBoom
labels: type:bug, type:regression, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.checkbox, feature:callbacks, feature:fast-reruns
summary: With `fastReruns=false`, adding delays in the script can cause `on_change` callbacks to fire for widgets that weren't interacted with. This indicates a race condition or state synchronization bug.

title: Support Multi-Tenant Folder Structure for Built-In Pages Navigation
author: marwanelmo
summary: Request for multi-tenant support in `st.navigation`, where the sidebar structure is dynamically generated based on the user's role or tenant ID using nested folders.

title: Optionally show nested spinners
author: nataziel
summary: Request to optionally show nested spinners within cached functions. Currently, only the top-level spinner is shown, hiding progress details of sub-functions.

title: In selectbox, if options chage from None to not, the defalut value rendered is still None.
author: vivianyang11
summary: `st.selectbox` fails to clear its value when options change from `None`/empty to a valid list if the previous selection was `None`. It stays stuck on `None` despite a valid default.

title: Session State convenience function for initialization
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Request for a convenience method (e.g., `st.session_state.init({...})`) to initialize multiple session state keys at once, reducing boilerplate code.

title: Add a parameter to automatically run the first page in `st.navigation`
author: jrieke
summary: Request for an `auto_run` parameter in `st.navigation` to automatically execute the selected page's function, removing the need for the explicit `.run()` call pattern.

title: `st.server_state` with endpoint access (like `st.session_state`, but for global values; different from pickled user sessions)
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Request for `st.server_state`: a global state store shared across all sessions, with an endpoint to update it externally. This supports use cases like IoT dashboards or shared counters.

title: file_uploader headers on https deployed streamlit app
author: Test-028
summary: When deployed behind an SSL-terminating load balancer, `st.file_uploader` sets incorrect CORS headers (`Access-Control-Allow-Origin`), causing upload failures. Configuration needs to handle forwarded protocols better.

title: Fragment to fragment (co-fragment) communication instead of rerunning entire app
author: Socvest
summary: Request for direct communication between fragments. Users want to trigger a rerun of one fragment from another without rerunning the entire app, enabling more efficient partial updates.

title: Implement browser session API
author: link89
summary: Request for a Browser Session API (`st.get_browser_session`) to identify and persist state for a specific browser client across refreshes and tab reopens.

title: Supress multiselect "Remove an option first". Message displays immediately upon reaching max selection.
author: LarryLoveIV
summary: `st.multiselect` shows a "Remove an option first" warning immediately when the max selection limit is reached. This is confusing; it should only appear if the user attempts to exceed the limit.

title: `st.cache_data` can't replay `st.status.update()` effect
author: Abdelgha-4
summary: Updates to `st.status` (e.g., changing label/state) are not replayed when the containing function is cached with `st.cache_data`. The status remains in its initial state on cache hits.

title: Add `height` and `key` to `st.columns`
author: iscoyd
summary: Request to add `height`, `border`, and `key` parameters directly to `st.columns`. This would simplify layouts by removing the need to nest `st.container` inside every column.

title: Setting max duration configuration parameter for st.audio_input()
author: iscoyd
summary: Request for a `max_duration` parameter in `st.audio_input` to enforce a time limit on recordings, preventing memory issues from unbounded audio capture.

title: `st.segmented_control`: Add vertical option
author: olliepro
summary: Request for a vertical layout option for `st.segmented_control`, allowing it to be used in sidebars or narrow columns effectively.

title: Disable row sorting in st.data_editor
author: mtst238
summary: Request to disable sorting in `st.data_editor` (via column headers) while keeping other interactive features enabled. Sorting can be undesirable for ordered datasets.

title: Add a min_selections parameter to st.multiselect
author: Unknownuserfrommars
summary: Request for a `min_selections` parameter in `st.multiselect` to enforce a minimum number of selected items, preventing users from deselecting everything.

title: Unable to drag to copy a value from one cell to a range of cells in the rightmost column of st.data_editor
author: JayBigGuy10
summary: The drag-to-fill handle in the rightmost column of `st.data_editor` is obstructed by the scrollbar, making it impossible to use. UI layering needs adjustment.

title: add an option to dataframe and data_editor to use the available window heigth
author: paorho
summary: Request for `st.dataframe` and `st.data_editor` to support filling the available window height (`use_window_height`), distinct from container width.

title: More consistent handling of relative paths
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Inconsistent relative path handling across Streamlit commands. Users want paths to consistently resolve relative to the entrypoint file first, then the working directory.

title: `st.date_input` doesn't show placeholder text when the initial value is a list of size one
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: `st.date_input` initialized with a single start date doesn't show the placeholder text for the end date. It appears blank, which is confusing UI state.

title: `y_min` and `y_max` not correctly honored in `*ChartColumn`. Input Values not clamped, if value range outside y limits defined in `column_config`
author: jonasViehweger
summary: `*ChartColumn` configurations ignore `y_min` and `y_max` limits if input values exceed them, causing the scale to auto-adjust instead of clamping. Users want fixed scales.

title: Show tooltip icon when `label_visiblity="hidden"`
author: Socvest
summary: Tooltip icons do not render for widgets when `label_visibility="hidden"`. Users want to access help text even if the label is hidden.

title: st.pydeck_chart does not suport pydeck globeview
author: cboettig
summary: `st.pydeck_chart` renders 3D globe views as flat 2D maps. Users want support for PyDeck's globe projection capabilities within Streamlit.

title: Sync `st.data_editor` to a database
author: dtiosd
summary: Request for a native way to sync `st.data_editor` changes back to a database automatically or via a dedicated callback, simplifying CRUD apps.

title: Use index value instead of row position in `session_state` of `st.data_editor`
author: mhupfauer
summary: `st.data_editor` session state tracks edited rows by their positional index (row number) rather than the DataFrame's index. This breaks logic when rows are sorted or filtered.

title: Tornado HTTPServer extra arguments
author: mysiar
summary: Request to expose Tornado's `max_header_size` and `max_body_size` settings in Streamlit config. This is needed for apps handling large URL parameters or headers.

title: Add 'key' to static widgets like st.link_button, st.popover
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: Request to add a `key` parameter to static widgets like `st.link_button` and `st.popover` to allow for targeted CSS styling via keys.

title: Stale output from a long-running computation erroneously shows as not stale when app rerun
author: sfc-gh-bnisco
summary: Stale output from a previous run of a long-running thread appears as valid (not stale) during a rerun until the old thread finishes. This confuses users about the data's freshness.

title: OpenAI realtime api support
author: freshchen
summary: Request to support OpenAI's Realtime API, specifically creating a voice-based chat interface (audio input/output) directly in Streamlit.

title: (CommunityCloud) Moving slider seems to generate 2 new (empty) window.history states
author: Asaurus1
summary: Interacting with widgets like sliders creates redundant, empty entries in the browser's history stack on Community Cloud, making the back button useless.

title: Allow fullscreen button for custom components
author: jrieke
summary: Request to allow custom components to have a standard Streamlit toolbar with a fullscreen button, matching native elements like charts.

title: `st.column_config.TimeColumn` does not enforce `step`
author: edsaac
summary: `st.column_config.TimeColumn` does not validate or enforce the `step` parameter. Users can enter times that do not align with the configured step interval.

title: segmented_control with a required value
author: RubenVanEldik
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.segmented_control, feature:st.pills
summary: Request for a `required=True` parameter in `st.segmented_control` (and pills) to prevent users from deselecting the option once selected.

title: RAG model not able to properly respond for second question even after adding session state
author: malay-gaherwar
summary: RAG models in Streamlit degrade in response quality on subsequent queries compared to Jupyter. Suspected issue with session state or context management during reruns.

title: st.column_config need radio components
author: joshua-xia
summary: Request to add a Radio Column type to `st.column_config`, allowing users to select a single option from a set within a dataframe cell.

title: Add a link to an image
author: adii2710
summary: Request for a simple way to make an `st.image` clickable with a link (e.g., `href` parameter), reducing the boilerplate of using Markdown for linked images.

title: Enable copy and paste between text fields to keep formatting
author: Kevin-McIsaac
summary: Text copied from `st.markdown` renders as plain text on clipboard. Users want it to copy as Markdown (preserving formatting) to paste into other Markdown editors.

title: BUG: `AppTest` sidebar does not clean widgets if not rendered in the last run of the script
author: SiddhantSadangi
summary: `AppTest` framework fails to clean up sidebar widgets that aren't rendered in the current script run, leading to ghost widgets in tests.

title: Add support for mplfinance with zoom and pan controls similar to st.plotly()
author: dsidlo
summary: Request for native support of `mplfinance` charts, including interactive features like zoom and pan, similar to how Plotly is supported.

title: InvalidStateError: CanvasRenderingContext2D.scale: Canvas is already in error state.
author: abokey1
summary: Firefox throws an `InvalidStateError` related to canvas scaling when rendering dataframes or editors. This seems to be a browser-specific rendering bug.

title: Enable row numbering in st.data_editor & st.dataframe
author: IsabellaI99
summary: Request to show row numbers in `st.data_editor`, mirroring the functionality available in `st.dataframe`. Useful for reference without adding data columns.

title: Using AppTest, st.dialog does not execute code within st.buttons
author: michue-work
summary: In `AppTest`, callbacks for buttons inside `st.dialog` are not executed. The test framework seems to miss interactions within modal contexts.

title: Allow using custom images for `icon` parameters
author: jrieke
summary: Request to allow passing custom images (local paths or URLs) to `icon` parameters in widgets, not just emojis or Material icons.

title: Allow st.form enter_to_submit to work for non-text elements
author: nickgreengithub
summary: The `enter_to_submit` behavior in `st.form` should work for all input types (like number inputs, radios), not just text inputs. This improves form usability.

title: Allow `packages.txt` inside a folder on Community Cloud
author: jrieke
summary: On Community Cloud, `packages.txt` must be at the repo root. Users want support for placing it in subdirectories alongside the app entrypoint, similar to `requirements.txt`.

title: `column_config.TimeColumn` does not work with `pd.Timedelta`
author: aBBDnGus
summary: `st.column_config.TimeColumn` displays `pd.Timedelta` objects incorrectly. It should format them appropriately or reject the type.

title: Add functionality to retrieve current playback time from `st.audio`
author: keli-wen
summary: Request for an API to retrieve the current playback position (timestamp) from `st.audio`. Critical for audio transcription or editing apps.

title: Support logarithmic axis scaling for `line_chart`
author: migueltorrescosta
summary: Request to support logarithmic scales (`logx`, `logy`) in `st.line_chart` and other built-in charts, exposing underlying Altair capabilities.

title: Keystroke Window Listening / Insert Cursor to Component
author: Anthony-Marcovecchio
summary: Request for global keystroke listening or a way to programmatically focus specific inputs. Useful for barcode scanner apps or keyboard-first navigation.

title: BUG: Unable to upload files due to both AxiosError (Network and 403)
author: abokey1
summary: File uploads fail with Network Error/403 on Kubernetes deployments. This is likely due to strict CORS/XSRF headers interacting with the environment's proxy setup.

title: Ability to clear audio from `st.audio_input` programmatically
author: nourishnew
summary: Request for a method to programmatically clear the recorded audio in `st.audio_input`. This allows resetting the input state after processing.

title: st.Video "crashing" when streaming mp4
author: dirkliebich
summary: `st.video` causes the app to crash or stop responding when fast-forwarding through streamed MP4 files. This indicates a media playback stability issue.

title: No right-click context menu for LinkColumn; no way to copy link / open in new tab
author: sfc-gh-jkinkead
summary: `LinkColumn` in dataframes does not support standard browser context menu actions like "Open in new tab" or "Copy link".

title: Get geo location / GPS coordinates of the user
author: joao-pompeu
summary: Request for a native component to access the user's geolocation (GPS coordinates) from the browser, enabling location-aware apps.

title: Allow streamlit apps to easily serve robots.txt at the root level
author: joshdavham
summary: Request for an easy way to serve a `robots.txt` file at the root of the app to control crawler access, which is currently difficult due to Streamlit's routing.

title: date_input grey out the year which is within the min_date and max_date range incorrectly
author: nijunwei-eaton
summary: `st.date_input` incorrectly disables selection for years that fall within the valid `min_value` and `max_value` range in the picker UI.

title: Allow multiple `st.container`'s to have the same `key`, to allow for styling multiple elements in the same category easily
author: blackary
summary: Using the same `key` for multiple `st.container` calls raises a duplicate key error. Users want to use keys as CSS classes for styling multiple elements.

title: Preserve URL fragment identifier / anchor when updating query params
author: benlindsay
summary: Updating query parameters via `st.query_params` inadvertently removes URL anchors (fragments), breaking deep links to page sections.

title: Allow popover to show more columns of a dataframe / data_editor
author: highroom
summary: Using `st.data_editor` inside an `st.popover` results in display issues where columns are hidden or data is not rendered correctly.

title: Seaborn / Matplotlib plot fails to render on cold start
author: joshdavham
summary: Seaborn and Matplotlib plots occasionally fail to render on cold starts in Cloud Run environments. This sporadic issue affects reliability.

title: Configure "View X more" in page navigation
author: annpeter3
summary: Request to configure the "View X more" grouping in the `st.navigation` sidebar. Users want control over how many items show before collapsing.

title: Streamlit changed the behavior of jupyter_client
author: jamiechoi1995
summary: Importing Streamlit alters `jupyter_client` behavior, changing output messages from `display_data` to `stream`. This breaks image rendering in notebooks.

title: non-edited files with class definitions appear to be re-imported whenever any project code is changed
author: HoopyFreud
summary: Files defining custom classes are re-imported on every rerun even if they haven't changed, causing `isinstance` checks to fail due to class redefinition.

title: Streamlit balloons not working in callback for function decorated with fragment
author: happinessbaby
summary: `st.balloons` fails to trigger when called inside a callback within an `st.fragment`. The effect is lost or interrupted.

title: www prefix should be supported on streamlit community cloud apps
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: Community Cloud apps do not support the `www.` subdomain prefix, leading to SSL errors. Users expect `www` to redirect to the main domain.

title: Support for dynamic  selection in st.data_editor with on_select event
author: salvogalati
summary: Users need a way to detect row or cell selection changes in `st.data_editor` dynamically without editing data. Currently, `st.data_editor` supports editing but lacks an `on_select` event, unlike `st.dataframe`. The request is to add an `on_select` parameter to `st.data_editor` to trigger callbacks when selections change, enabling interactive data-driven applications.

title: st.dataframe supports UserDrawnColumn for hover-enabled custom charts
author: romanzenka
summary: The user requests a `UserDrawnColumn` for `st.dataframe` to allow custom JavaScript rendering of cells, specifically for interactive charts. This would enable hover effects and custom visualizations (like sparklines) that are not possible with current column types. The proposed solution involves passing a JavaScript snippet or class to handle the drawing logic.
