title: Local images are not rendered in HTML when using st.write.
author: GLivshits
summary: Local images referenced in HTML passed to `st.write` are not rendering, although they work when opening the HTML file directly. This limits the ability to embed local assets in custom HTML content within Streamlit apps. The user expects local image paths to resolve correctly when rendered via `st.write(html, unsafe_allow_html=True)`.

title: Add  argument ```zoom``` to ```st.image``` to control whether the image can be enlarged
author: miloira
summary: The user requests a `zoom` argument for `st.image` to control whether the image can be enlarged by the user. This would allow developers to disable the default click-to-zoom behavior when it is not desired.

title: audio input auto-record and listen for silence
author: andehr
summary: `st.audio_input` currently requires manual recording control. The request is to add an "auto" mode that automatically starts recording and stops after a configurable duration of silence. This would streamline voice conversational apps by reducing the need for manual start/stop interactions.

title: Add argument `key` to more elements
author: jiyuxiongdi
summary: Users want the `key` argument to be available for more elements, specifically `st.metric`, to enable CSS styling via the key. Since version 1.39.0 allowed targeting elements by key, expanding this to all elements would improve styling consistency and control.

title: Config option to hide the deploy button
author: iuiu34
summary: The "Deploy" button is now enabled by default in the app toolbar, which some users find confusing or intrusive for non-developer users. The request is to add a configuration option in `config.toml` to hide the "Deploy" button, similar to how other toolbar items can be managed.

title: add feature support of markdown YAML front matter in `st.markdown`
author: Maicarons
summary: Users want `st.markdown` to support and parse YAML front matter in Markdown files. This would allow metadata (like title, layout) defined in the Markdown file to be accessible in Python, enabling dynamic page configuration based on the content.

title: torch.tensor should play well with st.write
author: treuille
summary: `st.write` should natively support PyTorch tensors (`torch.tensor`) by rendering them similarly to NumPy arrays. Currently, they do not display as formatted arrays. This would improve the developer experience for AI/ML workflows using PyTorch.

title: Activate virtual env when doing `streamlit run`, similar to `uv run`
author: jrieke
summary: The user suggests that `streamlit run` should automatically activate the virtual environment in the current directory, similar to `uv run`. This would simplify the workflow by removing the need to manually activate the environment before running the app.

title: `st.container` : Enable top and bottom sticky behaviours
author: behemothsecurity
summary: Users want to make `st.container` sticky, so it stays fixed at the top or bottom of the screen while scrolling. This is useful for headers, toolbars, or status bars in CRUD apps. The proposal is to add a `sticky` or `fixed` parameter to `st.container`.

title: `st.container` : Enable horizontal scrolling
author: behemothsecurity
summary: `st.container` currently only supports vertical stacking. The request is to enable horizontal scrolling for containers, allowing for richer layouts like carousels or wide tables without nesting columns. This would add a `direction` or `scrolling` parameter.

title: Add support for "max_height" for st.container
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: The user requests a `max_height` parameter for `st.container`. This would allow the container to grow dynamically up to a certain limit, after which it would scroll or truncate. This offers more flexible layout control than a fixed `height`.

title: Data editor looks weird when both `height` is set and `num_rows="dynamic"`
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: When `st.data_editor` has both `height` set and `num_rows="dynamic"`, the layout looks awkward with synthetic empty rows. The user suggests styling these rows differently or adjusting the behavior to look more natural while maintaining the "add row" functionality.

title: Flickering Dataframe when using st.fragment, but only when `on_select` is provided
author: user529481
summary: `st.dataframe` flickers and resets scroll/selection position on every `st.fragment` rerun when `on_select` is used. This makes it unusable for high-frequency updates. The component should retain its state (scroll, selection) during fragment updates to prevent flickering.

title: Multiple Video Quality/Dub versions
author: kaganerkan
summary: The user requests support for multiple video qualities and audio dubs in `st.video`, similar to YouTube or Netflix. This would allow serving different video sources based on bandwidth or user language preference.

title: Customize max number of rows before scrolling (st.dataframe / st.data_editor)
author: L3on02
summary: Users want to customize the maximum number of rows displayed in `st.dataframe` before scrolling triggers, instead of the default 10 rows. A parameter to set this limit would prevent large empty spaces for small datasets while allowing scrolling for larger ones.

title: Command line flags for common arguments
author: ziggycross
summary: The user proposes adding short command-line flags for common arguments, such as `-h` for headless, `-r` for run-on-save, and `-p` for port. This would make the CLI more standard and quicker to type.

title: Input Widgets defined inside Forms Experiencing Significant Lag (Text/Number Inputs)
author: makhai88
summary: Text and number inputs inside forms are experiencing significant lag, with delays in cursor appearance and typing. This performance issue disrupts data entry and needs optimization to ensure responsiveness.

title: Streamlit app autorefresh or autoreload
author: RajanGoyal1002
summary: A Streamlit app deployed on AWS EC2 refreshes or reloads automatically after a few minutes, causing data loss. This seems to be a session stability or websocket timeout issue on the deployment environment.

title: Test does not update according to the screen
author: rjmautvix
summary: `AppTest` fails to update button states correctly based on widget interactions (multiselect/selectbox) in tests, even though the logic works in the browser. This indicates a discrepancy between the testing framework's state management and the actual app runtime.

title: Customizable max length for options in st.multiselect
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: `st.multiselect` truncates long option labels, making them unreadable. The user requests a parameter to control the truncation length or a smarter way to display long values to improve usability.

title: Ability to customize Hamburger Menu
author: DhananjayPorwal
summary: Users want full customization of the hamburger menu, including hiding default items (like "Print") and adding custom items (like "Documentation"). Currently, customization is limited. A `menu_items` dictionary in `st.set_page_config` with more control is requested.

title: Code snippet to upload files to disk in chunks rather than in memory
author: codeSamuraii
summary: Streamlit stores uploaded files in memory, causing crashes with large files. The user provides a code snippet for chunked upload to disk using `python-multipart` and requests native support for disk-based uploads in `st.file_uploader` to handle large files efficiently.

title: File-based routing support including dynamic routing
author: hayata-yamamoto
summary: The user requests file-based routing for multipage apps similar to Next.js, supporting dynamic routes (e.g., `pages/datasets/[id].py`). This would simplify creating apps with many dynamic pages without writing complex routing logic in a single entry file.

title: Improve Core Web Vitals Performance Metrics
author: fabiogra
summary: Core Web Vitals (LCP, FCP) for Streamlit apps are suboptimal, affecting user experience and SEO. The user asks for performance improvements, noting that simple elements like `st.title` can cause high Largest Contentful Paint times.

title: Type-hint values in session_state.
author: amanlai
summary: Values in `st.session_state` lack type hinting support in IDEs like Pylance. The request is to improve type support, possibly via `TypedDict` or other mechanisms, so IDEs can provide autocomplete and error checking for session state attributes.

title: Add a clear all button to `st.file_uploader`
author: shakamoushie
summary: Users want a "Clear all" button in `st.file_uploader` to remove all attached files at once. Currently, removing multiple files requires clicking "x" on each one individually, which is tedious.

title: Allow streamlit app to be run as a normal python script with `python app.py`
author: blackary
summary: The user wants to run Streamlit apps directly with `python app.py` instead of `streamlit run app.py`. This would facilitate using tools like `uv run` with inline script dependencies, making standalone apps easier to share and run.

title: st.camera_input - Image size with low resolution at small pages
author: kevinzezel
summary: `st.camera_input` captures images at a resolution proportional to the screen size, resulting in low-quality images on mobile. The request is for the camera input to capture at full resolution regardless of the display size.

title: AppTest does not render content for pages in apps using st.navigation
author: nickveith
summary: `AppTest` fails to render content for pages in apps using the new `st.navigation` and `st.Page`. Content included in the entry point works, but page content is missing in tests. This prevents testing of multipage apps using the new navigation API.

title: Re-calculate dataframe column width when a column is sorted
author: sfc-gh-jsaito
summary: When sorting a dataframe column, the sort arrow takes up space and can cut off the column header text. The request is to automatically recalculate column width to accommodate the sort icon so the label remains fully visible.

title: The StreamlitCallbackHandler output of langchain React Agent is missing the “Thought ” part.
author: SenvenJ
summary: The `StreamlitCallbackHandler` for LangChain agents is missing the "Thought" part of the reasoning process in the UI, although it appears in logs. The user wants the full reasoning chain to be visible in the Streamlit app.

title: `TypeError` when requesting `_stcore/metrics` with sqlalchemy engine in session state
author: greg-el
summary: Requesting `/_stcore/metrics` throws a `TypeError` if a SQLAlchemy `Engine` is in session state. This seems to be an issue with the metrics endpoint trying to interact with the `_EmptyListener` object inside the engine.

title: Debugging Flow and Error Logging in the UI
author: om-tericsoft1
summary: The user requests a way to debug the entire app flow locally and save error logs for the whole execution to identify issues. This points to a need for better debugging and logging tools within the Streamlit development workflow.

title: selecting records from dataframe when updating data source
author: HFKunz
summary: `st.dataframe` selection is lost when the data source is updated, even if the data itself hasn't changed significantly. The user wants a way to persist selections across updates or manually set the selection state.

title: `Streamlit.setComponentValue` doesn't return `Set` type variables
author: cceyda
summary: `Streamlit.setComponentValue` in custom components does not handle JavaScript `Set` objects correctly, returning an empty object in Python. The request is to support `Set` serialization, likely by converting it to a list automatically.

title: Dynamic colour change based on the position of slider for `st.select_slider` widget
author: p1utoze
summary: Users want to change the color of the `st.select_slider` track dynamically based on the selected value (e.g., a rainbow gradient). Currently, it uses a single theme color. This would allow for more visually rich and informative sliders.

title: st.dialog Does Not Close Immediately After User Action if Followed by Blocking Operation (e.g. time.sleep(15))
author: pranay-tibco
summary: `st.dialog` does not close immediately after a button click if a blocking operation (like `time.sleep`) follows. The dialog remains visible until the operation completes. The user expects the dialog to dismiss instantly upon interaction.

title: Axios 403 error with file uploader when site is embedded in Iframe
author: akshay1728
summary: `st.file_uploader` fails with a 403 Axios error when the app is embedded in an iframe on Azure, likely due to cookie/CORS issues. The `streamlit_xsrf` cookie behavior seems inconsistent in iframes.

title: Popover in sidebar is outside of the viewable page
author: alon-sht
summary: A popover opened from the sidebar is cropped and overflows outside the viewable area if it extends beyond the sidebar width. The popover should ideally break out of the sidebar or position itself to remain fully visible.

title: Schedule app reboot
author: SiddhantSadangi
summary: The user requests a feature to schedule an app reboot on Community Cloud and notify users in-app. This would allow maintainers to refresh the app without abruptly disrupting active users.

title: Add option to identify new index.html files
author: shawngiese
summary: Users want to configure a custom `index.html` template via `config.toml` to easily inject scripts, CSS, or change meta tags. This would simplify advanced customization without needing to modify Streamlit internals.

title: Attempting to show a table with nested lists fails with `cannot mix list and non-list, non-null values`
author: bluenote10
labels: type:bug, area:arrow, feature:st.dataframe, status:confirmed, priority:P4, feature:st.data_editor, upstream
summary: Displaying a DataFrame containing nested lists fails with a PyArrow serialization error (`cannot mix list and non-list`). Streamlit should handle this case more gracefully, possibly by converting to string or using a compatible Arrow type.

title: Callback on st.metric click event
author: indrex
summary: Users want a click event or callback for `st.metric` to trigger actions, such as navigating to a detailed page. Currently, metrics are static displays.

title: Show dialog as a tooltip on widgets
author: shakamoushie
summary: The user wants to attach a dialog or help tooltip to specific widgets (like `text_input`) via a dedicated icon (e.g., "?"). This would allow providing context or a discussion thread specific to that input field.

title: Add custom icons to the dataframe toolbar
author: shakamoushie
summary: Users request the ability to add custom icons/actions to the `st.dataframe` toolbar, such as an "insert row" button or custom processing functions. This would extend the dataframe's interactivity.

title: Add support for `trendline` argument in `st.scatter_chart`
author: EwoutH
summary: `st.scatter_chart` lacks trendline support. Users want a `trendline` argument (e.g., "ols") to automatically overlay a trendline on the scatter plot, similar to Plotly Express.

title: Monospaced font on text_area
author: user529481
summary: `st.text_area` uses a proportional font by default. Users want an option to switch to a monospaced font for editing code or configuration text, or a dedicated `st.code_area` widget.

title: st.column_config.LinkColumn should have an option to open in the current tab
author: RubenVanEldik
summary: `LinkColumn` currently opens links in a new tab. Users want an option (`open_in_current_tab=True`) to open links in the same tab, which is useful for internal navigation within the app.

title: Popover is truncated when app is oembedded
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: `st.popover` content is truncated when the Streamlit app is embedded (oEmbed) in platforms like Medium. The popover positioning or z-index needs adjustment to work correctly in embedded contexts.

title: Provide a way to specify the starting port number for the free port search
author: chrispy-snps
summary: When specifying a port, Streamlit only tries that specific port. Users want a way to specify a start port and have Streamlit search for the next available one (e.g., `--server.port.from 8501`) to avoid "port in use" errors in shared environments.

title: st.bind() to attach query_params to session state
author: Asaurus1
summary: The user proposes `st.bind()` to automatically two-way bind session state variables to query parameters. This would simplify creating shareable, stateful URLs without manual boilerplate for every widget.

title: Rendering of HTML tables in Markdown is whitespace-sensitive
author: enrico-stauss
summary: Rendering HTML tables within Markdown via `st.markdown` is sensitive to whitespace, causing rendering issues. `st.write` handles it correctly. The Markdown parser should be more robust to whitespace in HTML blocks.

title: Non-Blocking Async Progress Bar
author: dsidlo
summary: Users request a non-blocking, async progress bar. This would allow the user to continue interacting with the app while a background process updates the progress bar, improving UX for long-running tasks.

title: Search should also work in column names of `st.dataframe`
author: jrieke
summary: Search in `st.dataframe` only searches cell values. Users want the search to also include column names, making it easier to find specific columns in wide datasets.

title: Query Params not preserved on first script run after using the browser "back" button to back to a previous page.
author: Asaurus1
summary: Query parameters are not preserved in `st.query_params` on the first run after navigating back in the browser history. They only appear after an interaction triggers a second rerun. This is a bug in state synchronization on history change.

title: Memory leak when sending PIL.Image to st.image()
author: ardhanapw
summary: Continuously updating `st.image` with PIL images causes a memory leak, eventually crashing the app. Streamlit seems to be retaining references to old image data.

title: Support custom LaTeX delimiters
author: davidgilbertson
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:markdown, feature:st.latex, feature:st.chat_message
summary: `st.write_stream` and `st.markdown` do not support OpenAI's LaTeX delimiters (`\(...\)`). Users want to define custom LaTeX delimiters or have built-in support for common formats to ensure math renders correctly from LLM responses.

title: auto-select next available port
author: fredzannarbor
summary: The user requests a flag (e.g., `take_next_available_port=True`) to automatically select an open port if the default 8501 is occupied. This would simplify running multiple apps or dealing with port conflicts.

title: allow st.dataframe single-row selection to force a selection (per radio button behaviour)
author: nickgreengithub
summary: `st.dataframe` single-row selection allows deselecting the row. Users want a mode that forces exactly one row to be selected at all times, similar to a radio button group, to ensure a valid state for downstream elements.

title: Decorators not being printed in `st.echo()`
author: SiddhantSadangi
summary: `st.echo()` fails to print decorators if they are the first line inside the block. Adding a line before the decorator fixes it. This is a parsing bug in `st.echo`.

title: Add `hide_index` to `st.table`
author: stoneone1
summary: Users request a `hide_index` parameter for `st.table`, similar to `st.dataframe`. Currently, static tables always show the index, which can be visually cluttered.

title: Popover and dialog first widget is always active
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: The first widget inside an `st.popover` or `st.dialog` appears active/focused by default. It should remain neutral until the user interacts with it.

title: st.fragment incompatible with streamlit.testing.v1.AppTest
author: Arthurhussey
summary: `st.fragment` decorated functions are not compatible with `AppTest`. They return `None` or don't execute in the test environment, making it impossible to unit test fragmented apps.

title: Old AI response duplicating (faded)
author: chrissimmerman
labels: type:bug, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.spinner, feature:st.chat_message, area:execution-model
summary: In a LangChain chat app, the previous AI response appears duplicated and faded when a new user message is submitted. This visual glitch persists until the new response generation starts.

title: Add alert when paste text bigger then max_chars into st.text_area
author: rajanant
summary: When a user pastes text exceeding `max_chars` in `st.text_area`, nothing happens, which is confusing. The user requests a visual alert or popup to indicate that the input was truncated or rejected.

title: file_uploader with large file results in server getting killed
author: MitchellWeg
summary: Uploading very large files (e.g., 3.5GB) via `st.file_uploader` kills the server due to excessive memory usage. Streamlit attempts to load the file into RAM. The request is to support streaming uploads to disk to handle large files.

title: Possible to stop cell from scrolling when double clicked on dataframe
author: elsuenog
summary: Double-clicking a cell in `st.dataframe` focuses it, but scrolling the table causes the focused cell to scroll along with the view, which is confusing. Users want to disable this specific interaction or improved focus behavior.

title: Using unittest.mock.patch on any function defined in an app that uses st.dialog raises StreamlitAPIException
author: ThomasNickerson
summary: Using `unittest.mock.patch` on a function in a Streamlit app causes a `StreamlitAPIException` if `st.dialog` is also used in the app. This conflict complicates testing dialog-heavy apps.

title: Allow fixed or full-screen window containers
author: ldmtwo
summary: Users request full-screen or fixed-position containers to build desktop-like layouts (e.g., split panes, toolbars, fixed maps). Currently, layout options are too constrained for these "app-like" designs.

title: Adding Stage Indicators to the Progress Bar
author: nayeonxkim
summary: Users want to add stage indicators (text/labels) to `st.progress` to show what step is currently executing (e.g., "Loading data", "Processing"). This provides better feedback than just a percentage.

title: Temp shareable URL
author: Clement-Lelievre
summary: Users want a way to generate a temporary shareable URL for a locally running app (tunneling), similar to Gradio. This facilitates quick sharing and testing with others without full deployment.

title: Slider with floats do not use the step parameter based on min_value when step can be casted to int (e.g. 1.0)
author: Djkmarco
summary: `st.slider` with float values behaves incorrectly when `step` is an integer (e.g., 1.0). It steps relative to 0 instead of `min_value`, making some values unreachable.

title: Disallow linking to page that contains `st.navigation`
author: Sairam90
summary: Linking to a page that contains `st.navigation` causes multiple runs and a `MaxRecursionError`. The router logic gets stuck in a loop. Streamlit should prevent or handle this recursive navigation setup.

title: Allow configuring HTTP Security Headers
author: dcoe-jkpaper
summary: Users want to configure HTTP security headers (HSTS, CSP, X-Frame-Options) and remove the "TornadoServer" banner to improve security. These should be configurable in `config.toml`.

title: Add support for instrumentation and observability
author: shikanime
summary: The user proposes adding OpenTelemetry support to Streamlit for observability. This would allow tracking performance metrics, request latency, and tracing across components for better troubleshooting.

title: Session Disconnecting when using Chromadb and similarity_search_with_relevance_scores
author: kamgreenwald
summary: Using ChromaDB's similarity search within Streamlit causes the session to disconnect immediately without an error message. This suggests a lower-level crash or conflict, possibly related to threading or dependencies.

title: Allow using a different package manager than `poetry` if `pyproject.toml` exists
author: jjangga0214
summary: Streamlit Cloud forces `poetry` if `pyproject.toml` is present. Users who use `pdm` (which also uses `pyproject.toml`) want to be able to specify their package manager instead of having it auto-detected incorrectly.

title: cache working when migrating from one test to another
author: plabautvix
summary: Caching behavior is inconsistent when running multiple tests via `AppTest`. A cached function returns the result from a previous test run, leaking state between tests. Tests should be isolated.

title: streamlit header feature request for central aligned methods
author: githubofkrishnadhas
summary: Users want a central alignment option for `st.header` and its divider. Currently, dividers are fixed, and centered headers look unbalanced if the divider doesn't adjust.

title: AppTest: removing input fields on rerun may lead to "We'll never get here" condition in session_state
author: pwbetteridge
summary: In `AppTest`, removing input fields during a rerun (e.g., via conditional logic) causes a `KeyError` in session state, hitting a "We'll never get here" code path. The testing framework needs to handle dynamic widget removal correctly.

title: st.json select fields to auto collapse
author: kim-borgen
summary: `st.json` expands or collapses all nodes by default. Users want to specify a list of fields to auto-collapse (or expand) to focus on the most relevant data in large JSON objects.

title: Allow display_text of LinkColumn to use value of another column
author: NielsRogge
summary: Users want `LinkColumn` to display text from a *different* column instead of the URL itself. This allows creating clean links where the clickable text is meaningful (e.g., a title) but the link target is data-driven.

title: Behavior of `st.query_params` a step backward from experimental versions
author: alexscott-ff
summary: The `st.query_params` API changes made handling multiple values for the same key more difficult. The user finds the dictionary-like behavior (returning only the last value) confusing and requests a method to easily get all values.

title: dataframe and table does not show changed header text of styled dataframes
author: hoegge
summary: `st.dataframe` does not respect header renames applied via Pandas `Styler.format_index`. The original column names are shown instead. The component should display the styled header names.

title: Display SVGs with `st.image` without needing to set a `width` value
author: emerzon
summary: Some SVG files fail to display in `st.image` unless a `width` is explicitly set. Streamlit should handle SVG dimensions robustly without requiring manual width specification.

title: Support skin tones in emojis (update remark-emoji/node-emoji dependency)
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: The `node-emoji` dependency is outdated, missing support for skin tone emojis. Updating it would allow users to use diverse emojis in shortcodes (e.g., `:wave::skin-tone-2:`).

title: use_container_width=True not working for Altair facet charts
author: foldager
labels: type:bug, status:confirmed, priority:P3, feature:st.altair_chart, feature:st.vega_lite_chart, upstream
summary: `use_container_width=True` does not work correctly for Altair facet charts; they do not expand to fill the container. This layout issue makes faceted charts look small or misaligned.

title: Enhanced JavaScript File Serving in Streamlit
author: mixxen
summary: Streamlit serves JavaScript files with `text/plain` MIME type by default. Users request the correct `application/javascript` type to support WebGL and other JS-heavy integrations without needing a proxy.

title: More style options on st.page_link()
author: davinishi
summary: `st.page_link` lacks styling options. Users want to customize background color, text size, and other CSS properties to make navigation buttons look like proper UI elements.

title: widget cannot get default value from session state if it is placed in conditional statement
author: liunux4odoo
summary: A widget inside a conditional block fails to pick up its default value from `st.session_state` if the condition toggles. The value remains in session state, but the widget doesn't reflect it upon reappearing.

title: Allow multiple time-series for chart dataframe columns
author: lucasrodes
summary: Users want to display multiple time-series lines within a single `LineChartColumn` cell in `st.dataframe`. This enables comparing two trends (e.g., current vs. previous) in a compact tabular view.

title: Need to know current page url in the entry python file.
author: ChuanqiTan
summary: Users need access to the current page URL in the main entry file (`app.py`) to implement global authentication logic (e.g., redirecting to login if not on the login page). A `st.get_current_url()` or similar context is requested.

title: Change page title and favicon in the initial HTML
author: yguedidi
summary: Users want to configure the initial HTML page title and favicon (meta tags) for better link previews when sharing the app. Currently, these are set via JS, which crawlers often miss.

title: Interactive `st.altair_chart` with `st.dataframe` on page causes application to jump
author: broughtonjp
summary: Interacting with an `st.altair_chart` causes the page scroll position to jump if an `st.dataframe` is also present. This focus jumping is disruptive to the user experience.

title: Rerun upon events dispatched by third-party libraries
author: whitphx
summary: Users request a way to trigger Streamlit reruns based on external events (e.g., Firestore updates) without polling. A `useSyncExternalStore`-like mechanism is proposed to handle third-party event sources.

title: Tailwindcss Support
author: seekerquest
summary: Users request native support for Tailwind CSS classes in Streamlit components (e.g., `st.container(classes="p-4 flex")`). This would simplify styling without writing custom CSS blocks.

title: Current recommended way to deal with restarted Streamlit sessions, for both recovering the session state and continuing calculations
author: andrew-weisman
summary: Users on platforms like Palantir Foundry experience random session restarts. They request best practices or features to continuously persist session state and long-running jobs to recover seamlessly from these restarts.

title: Allow links to external web pages in the new navigation sidebar
author: mahotd
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:multipage-apps, feature:st.navigation
summary: The new `st.navigation` does not support external links in the sidebar menu. Users want to mix internal page links with external URLs (e.g., documentation, homepage) in the main navigation structure.

title: Cannot Use kwargs Only  in Snowflake Connection
author: kyleburke-meq
summary: Attempting to pass environment variables as kwargs to `st.connection` for Snowflake fails with an error because the connector expects a 'default' connection name in `secrets.toml` even when explicit credentials are provided. Users want to be able to initialize a Snowflake connection purely via kwargs without relying on a secrets file.

title: st.switch_page does not function (throws error) within a try/except block
author: Spudmeist3r
summary: `st.switch_page` raises an error when called inside a `try/except` block, claiming the page doesn't exist, whereas it works fine outside the block. This behavior is inconsistent and prevents error handling patterns that involve navigation.

title: AppTest - add support for st.image and st.download_button
author: mpalmer23
summary: Request to add support for `st.image` and `st.download_button` in `AppTest`. This would allow developers to write automated tests verifying the presence and properties of images and download buttons in their apps.

title: Returning data from plot interactions doesn't work with Plotly Treemaps
author: shkarlsson
labels: type:enhancement, good first issue, feature:st.plotly_chart, area:events
summary: Plotly Treemaps do not return selection events (`on_select`) despite user interactions like clicking. The returned event dictionary remains empty. This limits interactivity for treemap visualizations compared to other chart types.

title: vega_lite_chart does not return a catchable Exception when the specs does not conform with Vega-Lite
author: georgetakla
summary: `st.vega_lite_chart` renders an uncatchable frontend error box when passed an invalid Vega-Lite spec, instead of raising a Python exception. Users want to be able to catch these errors in Python to handle invalid specs gracefully.

title: Ability to embed metadata for SEO indexing with Google Search Console, Analytics or Tag Manager trackers
author: AlisterBaroi
summary: Request for a method (e.g., `st.metadata`) to inject SEO and tracking metadata (Google Analytics, Search Console tags) into the app header. This is crucial for public apps needing search indexing and analytics.

title: Add a user entrypoint executed on startup before page loding
author: Kamilcuk
summary: Users request a way to define a startup entrypoint script or function in `config.toml` that runs before the Streamlit server starts. This would allow setting up background threads, custom logging, or patching server internals.

title: Support nested url paths for Multipage Apps
author: zebernst
summary: Writing a DataFrame to a page loaded via `st.navigation` with a nested URL path fails with a frontend error (SyntaxError in chunk.js). This works on the main page but breaks on nested pages, suggesting a path resolution or resource loading bug.

title: Endpoint to get number of app views
author: SiddhantSadangi
summary: Request for a view counter badge endpoint for apps hosted on Streamlit Community Cloud. This would allow developers to display app popularity statistics (views) in their READMEs or docs.

title: Add Support for Streamlit Configuration in pyproject.toml
author: Legendary256
summary: Request to support Streamlit configuration via `pyproject.toml` (under `[tool.streamlit]`) instead of requiring a separate `.streamlit/config.toml`. This aligns with modern Python project configuration standards.

title: "ImportError: cannot import name 'runtime_version' from 'google.protobuf'" when developing on MacOS
author: whitphx
summary: Documentation issue: Developing Streamlit on macOS can fail with an `ImportError` related to `google.protobuf` versions. The workaround involves reinstalling protobuf via Homebrew. The contribution guide needs updating to address this environment conflict.

title: Custom theme stays active if `config.toml` is deleted
author: jrieke
summary: Deleting `config.toml` does not revert the app's theme to default if a custom theme was previously active. The theme persists in the browser's local storage. Users expect the app appearance to reflect the current (or missing) config file.

title: Sort by column value for timedelta uses string representation rather than underlying value
author: ptrba
summary: Sorting a DataFrame column containing `timedelta` objects sorts by their string representation rather than the underlying time value. This leads to incorrect sorting (e.g., "14 days" < "2 hours"). Sorting should respect the actual timedelta values.

title: st.popover with many rows deploys above the "button" when there are many items [based on the screen size]
author: mhollander
summary: When `st.popover` contains many items, it sometimes renders *above* the button on smaller screens or zooms, which is unexpected. Users expect consistent positioning (below or auto-adjusted) with scrollbars if needed.

title: Chart Selection not working on all plotly charts (e.g. Sankey; +heatmap/imshow)
author: smomen
summary: Chart selection (`on_select`) does not work for Plotly Sankey diagrams, Heatmaps, or Imshow plots. Interactions do not trigger reruns or return selection data. Users want consistent selection support across all Plotly chart types.

title: Streamlit messing up with selection indicies in st.plotly_chart
author: Ibrokhimsadikov
summary: Selection indices returned by `st.plotly_chart` are incorrect or messed up when using lasso/box select on a scatter plot. This prevents accurate identification of selected data points for downstream processing.

title: Integrated with VTable
author: fangsmile
summary: Request to integrate VTable, a high-performance visualization table library, into Streamlit. This would offer an alternative to the current dataframe component with potentially better performance for large datasets.

title: Let large Plotly charts extend beyond the container width
author: Ethan-Loo
summary: Plotly charts with fixed dimensions defined in `update_layout` are resizing incorrectly in Streamlit versions >1.33.0. Users want the option to strictly respect the figure's layout dimensions without Streamlit overriding them.

title: Can not install milvus SDK
author: mrpoponep
summary: Deploying an app using the Milvus SDK on Community Cloud fails during the build process (stuck on building `grpcio-tools`). This seems to be a dependency installation issue specific to the Cloud environment.

title: Leave site? Changes you made may not be saved.
author: marcotielen
summary: Request for an option to enable the "Leave site?" browser confirmation dialog (`beforeunload` event). This prevents users from accidentally closing the tab and losing unsaved state, which is critical for data entry apps.

title: Reconnect to existing sessions instead of creating new upon unclean websocket close.
author: vjr
summary: Unclean WebSocket closures (e.g., flaky network) cause Streamlit to start a new session instead of reconnecting to the existing one. Users want session restoration to preserve state after temporary disconnections.

title: Allow multiple value paste to st.multiselect
author: cshuphys
summary: Users want to paste a delimited string (e.g., "A, B, C") into `st.multiselect` to automatically select multiple options at once. Currently, options must be selected individually, which is tedious for bulk entry.

title: Unable to persist camera view in 3d plotly charts
author: lucasimi
summary: Interacting with a 3D Plotly chart resets the camera view to default in recent Streamlit versions, ignoring `uirevision`. Users expect the camera angle to persist across reruns/updates for continuity.

title: Able to configure a set of available dates for date_input
author: daviddwlee84
summary: Request to restrict `st.date_input` to a specific set of allowed dates (allowlist), rather than just a min/max range. This is useful for scheduling apps where only specific days are available.

title: Gray in st.markdown is different from st.caption
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: The gray color used in `st.markdown(":gray[...]")` does not match the default gray of `st.caption`. Users request consistent color definitions across Markdown and standard text elements for visual uniformity.

title: Add "black" to supported Markdown colors, mostly for st.caption
author: arnaudmiribel
summary: Request to add `:black[...]` as a supported color in Markdown. This allows users to style text (like captions) to match standard widget labels, offering more design flexibility.

title: Use multindex from dataframe in charts
author: PiotrDerewonko
summary: Request for native support of MultiIndex DataFrames in built-in charts (`st.bar_chart`, etc.). Currently, users must flatten or reset indexes to visualize hierarchical data.

title: Code editor component (`st.code_editor`)
author: B4PT0R
summary: Request for a native `st.code_editor` widget. While `st.code` displays code, users need a robust editor with syntax highlighting and editing capabilities for advanced use cases like SQL queries or Python scripting.

title: Preserve row selections when sorting `st.dataframe` on the frontend
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Sorting `st.dataframe` on the frontend clears the current row selection. Users expect selections to persist across sorting operations to maintain context during data exploration.

title: Make `st.help` render restructured text when passes Streamlit objects
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: `st.help` does not render reStructuredText (RST) docstrings correctly (e.g., double backticks). Since Streamlit uses RST internally, `st.help` should properly parse and display it.

title: st.code modifies text when copied.
author: hucker
summary: `st.code` trims trailing whitespace from the displayed text when copying to the clipboard. This breaks use cases where precise string content (including whitespace) is required.

title: display multiple links in st.column_config.LinkColumn
author: mjstrumillo
summary: Request to support multiple hyperlinks in a single cell of `LinkColumn`. Currently, it supports only one link per cell. Users want to display lists of links.

title: Add “bottom” scroll behavior to container
author: niksa27
summary: Request for a "scroll to bottom" behavior for `st.container`. This is useful for chat interfaces or logs where the most recent content should be visible automatically.

title: plotly_chart support for click event
author: yujqiao
summary: Request for click events in `st.plotly_chart` similar to Dash. `on_select` doesn't capture simple clicks on line plots well without markers. Users want to capture interaction with any plot element.

title: Support ip whitelist
author: yujqiao
summary: Request for an IP allowlist configuration (`--server.ipAllowlist`) to restrict access to the Streamlit app to specific IP ranges. This adds a layer of security for internal or proxy-served apps.

title: Add size/height parameter to buttons
author: behemothsecurity
labels: type:enhancement, area:styling, feature:st.download_button, feature:st.button, feature:st.link_button, feature:st.form_submit_button
summary: Request to add a `size` or `height` parameter to buttons. The default button size is sometimes too large for compact UIs. Users want control over button dimensions.

title: Simplify and expand st.alert , st.warning, st.info, st.success with `st.card()` or `st.block()`
author: behemothsecurity
summary: Proposal to consolidate alert components (`st.info`, `st.warning`, etc.) into a single `st.alert` or `st.card` with a `style` parameter. This simplifies the API and allows for more flexible styling.

title: Have st.column_config use JSONSCHEMA to populate the columns and their config
author: kiddigital
summary: Request to populate `st.column_config` automatically from a JSON Schema. This would allow `st.data_editor` to enforce validation and types defined in an existing data contract without manual config.

title: Layout Issue on Mobile View
author: Jaquavious-Finkleton
summary: Streamlit 1.33+ renders components more compactly on mobile views compared to previous versions. Users find this layout change undesirable and request a fix or configuration to restore spacing.

title: Anchor does not change on rerun()
author: esnible
summary: `st.subheader` anchor links do not update when the header text changes during a rerun. The link remains stale, pointing to the old header value.

title: Support client-side validation via regex pattern for `st.text_input`
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Request for client-side regex validation in `st.text_input` via a `validate` parameter. This would provide immediate feedback to users without requiring a server roundtrip.

title: Add selection support for built-in charts
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Request to add selection support (`on_select`) to built-in charts (`st.line_chart`, etc.), enabling interactive filtering similar to what was added for Altair and Plotly.

title: `plotly_chart`'s new `on_select` feature is poorly integrated with subplots and hovermodes
author: Chiyun-Lee
summary: Plotly `on_select` integration is buggy with subplots and unified hover modes. Selections behave erratically or report incorrect data when using these advanced Plotly features.

title: New Selection mode on st.altair_chart doesn't work with binding_radio and binding_select
author: ProkhorZakharov
summary: `st.altair_chart` selections break when using Altair's binding widgets (radio/select). Enabling selection causes rendering issues and hides chart data.

title: Return selected dataframe rows in order of selection
author: LiwoJima
summary: Request for `st.dataframe` to return selected row indices in the order they were clicked, rather than sorted by index. This allows capturing the sequence of user selection.

title: plotly_chart `on_select` not returning anything for an imshow or heatmap
author: hoggatt
summary: `st.plotly_chart` returns no selection data for `imshow` or `heatmap` charts. Users expect pixel or region clicks to report coordinates/values for image annotation workflows.

title: Custom 404 / Error Page / Maintenance Page that is displayed whenever a bug is pushed or the app encounters and issue on boot
author: Emad-Eldin-G
summary: Request for customizable 404 / Error / Maintenance pages. Instead of generic tracebacks, developers want to show branded, user-friendly error screens when the app crashes or is down.

title: st.button - add delay to `help` tooltip
author: ivan-schinella
summary: Request to add a delay to `help` tooltips on buttons. Immediate tooltips can obstruct UI elements. A delay parameter would improve UX.

title: Be able to close cached resources (@st.cache_resource)
author: gerbenoostra
summary: Request for a way to close/cleanup resources cached with `@st.cache_resource` (e.g., DB connections) when they are invalidated or the app stops. Currently, resources can be left dangling.

title: Video input support for `st.chat_input`
author: jrieke
summary: Request for video input support in `st.chat_input`. As multimodal LLMs grow, users want to send video content directly through the chat interface.

title: Nested Selectbox Component
author: mkleinbort-ic
summary: Request for a nested selectbox component to handle hierarchical options. Users want to group options (e.g., Category -> Sub-option) without using multiple widgets.

title: add `get_tornado_instance` as an experimental API
author: link89
summary: Request to expose the underlying Tornado instance (`get_tornado_instance`) to allow advanced users to add custom routes or headers (e.g., for auth cookies) not natively supported by Streamlit.

title: Zoom/pan events for charts
author: jrieke
summary: Request to capture zoom and pan events from charts. This would allow the app to react to the user's viewport changes, enabling dynamic data loading (e.g., fetching more detail on zoom).

title: Zoom/pan events for maps
author: jrieke
summary: Similar to chart zoom events, a request to capture zoom/pan events for maps (`st.map`, `st.pydeck_chart`) to enable location-aware data fetching.

title: Add refresh feature to cache
author: PaleNeutron
summary: Request for a background refresh mechanism for cached functions. Instead of making the user wait on expiry, return the stale value immediately and refresh the cache in the background.

title: Support chart selections for multi-view vega-lite & altair charts
author: lukasmasuch
summary: Chart selections in `st.altair_chart` do not work with multi-view charts (layered, concat). Users request support for interactivity in these complex composite charts.

title: Move st.app_state further up in the roadmap
author: user529481
summary: High-priority request for better state management (`st.app_state`) to persist state across reruns without manual boilerplate. The current rerun model complicates state handling for complex apps.

title: Inconsistent case sensitivity (`streamlit run`, `st.switch_page`, and the file name)
author: MathCatsAnd
summary: `st.switch_page` is case-sensitive on Mac depending on how the app was launched (e.g., `run app.py` vs `run App.py`). It should reliably find pages regardless of filename casing nuances.

title: Add an `on_complete` or `on_focus_leave` for `st.data_editor` to debounce saving state
author: Ben-Epstein
summary: Request for an `on_blur` or `on_complete` event for `st.data_editor`. Currently, `on_change` fires on every keystroke/cell edit, causing premature reruns. Users want to trigger updates only when they leave the table.

title: `st.runtime.get_instance()._session_mgr.list_active_sessions()[0].client.request.protocol` is http on https pages.
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: Streamlit reports the protocol as `http` even when running on `https` (e.g., Community Cloud). This affects logic that depends on detecting the correct protocol.

title: Add support for alpha channel in `st.image`'s `channels` argument
author: SebastianScherer88
summary: Request to support 4-channel images (RGBA) in `st.image` to correctly render transparency. Currently, masking or alpha channels are sometimes ignored or handled incorrectly.

title: Show preview images in `st.file_uploader`
author: jrieke
summary: `st.file_uploader` shows a generic icon for uploaded images. Users want a thumbnail preview of the actual uploaded image to confirm the selection.

title: Make `st.chat_input` show up at the bottom even if used in a tab
author: XinyueZ
summary: `st.chat_input` fails to stick to the bottom when placed inside `st.tabs`. It renders at the top of the tab content instead. It should maintain its sticky behavior in all containers.

title: Add alt text to images & charts for improved accessibility
author: jrieke
summary: Request to add `alt_text` parameters to images and charts for accessibility. This ensures screen readers can describe visual content to users.

title: st.date_input not working in the sidebar on mobile devices or very narrow windows
author: jgieseler
summary: `st.date_input` in the sidebar closes the sidebar immediately when clicked on mobile or narrow screens, making it unusable. Interaction should not auto-collapse the sidebar.

title: Shut down the session after closing the browser tab by the user
author: Anna050689
summary: Request to detect when a user closes the browser tab to perform backend cleanup (e.g., close sessions). Currently, the server keeps the session alive for a timeout period.

title: Not handled DecodeError on the server side on file upload with double extension
author: murmuruuu
summary: File uploads with double extensions (e.g., `.php.xlsx`) can cause unhandled `DecodeError` tracebacks on the server. This should be handled gracefully with a user-friendly error.

title: Unable to upload >980 files using file_uploader
author: keyfayaz
summary: `st.file_uploader` hangs or fails when uploading a large number of files (>980). This seems to be an internal limit or performance bottleneck in processing many files at once.

title: Altair Grouped Barchart with st.altair_chart(use_container_width=True) creates multiple charts instead of one single grouped chart
author: sapphire008
summary: `st.altair_chart(use_container_width=True)` breaks grouped bar charts, rendering them as multiple separate charts instead of a single grouped visualization.

title: Nested Grids for Grouping Rows - Feature Request
author: ghost
summary: Request for nested grids and row grouping in `st.dataframe`. Users want to group rows by column values and expand/collapse groups, similar to pivot tables.

title: Support chart selections (with `on_select`) for Altair v4
author: jrieke
summary: Chart selections currently require Altair v5. Users request backporting this feature to Altair v4 for compatibility with legacy environments.

title: rerun fragment only programatically with `st.fragment` instead of `run_every`
author: ambroser53
summary: Request for `st.fragment` to support programmatic reruns (e.g., `st.rerun_fragment()`) instead of just time-based `run_every`. This allows event-driven updates for specific app sections.

title: Prevent layout shift caused by scrollbars
author: gabrieltempass
summary: Scrollbars appearing/disappearing cause layout shifts, pushing content left/right. Users request a way to reserve scrollbar space (`scrollbar-gutter`) to prevent this jitter.

title: `st.selectbox` sometimes ignores user input when order of `options` changes
author: nathancooperjones
summary: `st.selectbox` ignores user input intermittently when the `options` list order is modified dynamically. The widget should respect the user's selection even if the underlying list changes.

title: Add support for multi-threading/multi-processing in Streamlit
author: harsh9898
summary: Request for native multi-threading support. Users want to run background tasks without blocking the main thread, and without manually managing script contexts (`add_script_run_ctx`).

title: Parameter for DELAY_SEC in st.spinner
author: zoltan-spire
summary: Request to customize the default 0.5s delay in `st.spinner`. Users want to remove the delay to show instant feedback or adjust it for specific workflows.

title: Native asyncio support
author: thorin-schiffer
summary: Request for native `asyncio` support. Currently, running async code in Streamlit is difficult and error-prone due to event loop conflicts. Users want first-class async/await support.

title: Streamlit Deploy as a Jupyter Server extension.
author: rishabh-dream11
summary: Request to deploy Streamlit apps as Jupyter Server extensions. This would allow data scientists to host apps directly from their existing Jupyter infrastructure.

title: Live chat inside of an app
author: jivishov
summary: Request for a live peer-to-peer chat component. Users want to build messenger-like features within Streamlit apps without complex custom implementations.

title: st.data_editor column order not respected when column name type is not str
author: timotk
summary: `st.data_editor` forces column order to change if column names are integers. It sorts them instead of respecting the provided DataFrame order.

title: Support setting path to `.streamlit/` through streamlit run CLI or similar?
author: andreped
summary: Streamlit expects `.streamlit/` config to be next to the app script. Users request a CLI flag (`--streamlit-dir`) to specify a custom config directory location.

title: Easy-to-use api to access clients clipboard
author: ivi-kiwi
summary: Request for a clipboard API (`st.clipboard`) to read/write to the client's clipboard. This enables "Copy to Clipboard" buttons for custom content.

title: Unable to test a multipage app which consists a custom sidebar using AppTest
author: zeeshansayyed
summary: Testing multipage apps with custom sidebars fails in `AppTest`. The test runner cannot resolve page paths correctly when they are linked via `st.page_link` in a custom navigation setup.

title: Allow selectbox column to show options that are not part of the available options
author: itsToggle
summary: `SelectboxColumn` in `st.data_editor` blanks out values if they are removed from the options list. Users want to display existing values even if they are no longer valid options for new edits.

title: Possibility to disable the "Download as CSV" button on st.dataframe/st.data_editor
author: heitormarcal
summary: Request to disable the "Download as CSV" button on dataframes. This is needed for data security to prevent easy exfiltration of displayed data.

title: Basic accessibility web features
author: juanramonua
summary: Request for basic web accessibility features, such as setting the page `lang` attribute and accessible naming for links/structure, to comply with standards.

title: Connection for duckdb
author: ReneTC
summary: Request for a native DuckDB connection in `st.connection`. DuckDB is popular for local analytics, and a first-party connector would simplify setup.

title: Server hangs on startup when offline
author: AnOctopus
summary: Streamlit server hangs on startup when offline, waiting for network timeouts. It should start immediately even without an internet connection.

title: Maybe st.chat_input and st.chat_message make the scroll bar jitter
author: VittorioYan
summary: Users report scrollbar jitter when using `st.chat_input` and `st.chat_message` together on long pages. The layout seems to fluctuate during rendering.

title: Allow users to drag a slider & select_slider range (start and end) by grabbing the bar itself
author: mkleinbort-ic
summary: Request to allow dragging the entire range bar in `st.slider` (range mode) to move both start and end values simultaneously while maintaining the interval.

title: Support for audio and video via column config for `st.dataframe`
author: hadariru
summary: Request for `AudioColumn` and `VideoColumn` in `st.column_config`. This would allow rendering media players directly inside dataframe cells.

title: Impossible to disable st.chat_input while writing the model's response
author: Napuh
summary: Users want to disable `st.chat_input` while the bot is responding to prevent interrupted state. Currently, `disabled` state doesn't update reliably during streaming.

title: Alignment issue with help tooltips inside st.popover
author: mkleinbort-ic
summary: Help tooltips inside `st.popover` are clipped if they extend beyond the popover's boundaries. Tooltips should detect boundaries and position themselves to remain visible.

title: Select/Deselect All for st.data_editor - st.column_config.CheckboxColumn
author: darkb1u3
summary: Request for a "Select All" checkbox in the header of a `CheckboxColumn` in `st.data_editor`. This allows bulk selection/deselection of rows.

title: Quick replies/suggestions for chat user response
author: austinmw
summary: Request for "Quick Replies" or suggestion chips in `st.chat_input`. Users want to present clickable predefined responses above the chat input.

title: `st.cache_resource` and `st.cache_data` should support async functions (coroutines)
author: whitphx
summary: `st.cache_data` and `st.cache_resource` do not support `async` functions. Decorating a coroutine fails because the coroutine object itself is cached/pickled, not the result.

title: Accessibility: Allow color customization for the uploaded file size text in the st.file_uploader
author: kwaksaewon
summary: Accessibility request to customize the color of the file size text in `st.file_uploader` to meet contrast ratio standards.

title: Accessibility: Allow color customization for the 'Limit 200 MB per file' text in the st.file_uploader
author: kwaksaewon
summary: Accessibility request to customize the color of the "Limit 200MB" text in `st.file_uploader` to improve contrast for low-vision users.

title: `st.popover` not closing when opening another PopOver
author: sfc-gh-cserrano
summary: Clicking a second `st.popover` button while one is open (with an active dropdown inside) fails to close the first one properly. UI state gets confused.

title: Allow specifying the location of `requirements.txt`
author: ConnorStoneAstro
summary: Request to specify the path to `requirements.txt` on Community Cloud. Users want to organize app dependencies in subfolders.

title: Accessibility: Allow color customization for the placeholder text character count in the st.text_input
author: kwaksaewon
summary: A request for accessibility improvement in `st.text_input`: users want to customize the color of the placeholder text character count. The current contrast ratio is too low (2.27:1) for accessibility standards.

title: Keep symbolic links / re-resolve symlinks if target changes
author: exic
summary: Streamlit fails to handle symbolic links correctly during hot reloads if the symlink target changes (e.g., in Kubernetes ConfigMaps). Users expect Streamlit to re-resolve the symlink path instead of crashing with `FileNotFoundError`.

title: Expanded `st.selectbox`
author: captnswing
summary: Request for an "expanded" mode for `st.selectbox` (using the HTML `size` attribute) to show multiple options at once without a dropdown. This facilitates cascading selects and faster data entry.

title: Improve the customization of all of elements
author: lix8886
summary: A broad request for more granular styling customization for all Streamlit elements (color, size, alignment). Users feel the current preset styles are too limiting for refined UI designs.

title: Color banding option for dataframe & data_editor rows
author: sfc-gh-cfrasca
summary: Request for a row color banding option (zebra striping) in `st.data_editor` and `st.dataframe`. This improves readability for wide tables without requiring complex Pandas Styler workarounds.

title: Add open/close parameter to st.popover
author: sfc-gh-bhess
summary: Request to add an `expanded` parameter to `st.popover` to programmatically control its open/closed state. This allows closing the popover automatically after an action, like a form submission.

title: Confirm button click
author: qianma819
summary: Request for a built-in confirmation dialog for `st.button`. Users want a simple way to ask "Are you sure?" before executing sensitive actions triggered by a button click.

title: Accessibility: Allow color customization for the current character count in the st.text_input.
author: kwaksaewon
summary: Accessibility request to customize the color of the character count indicator in `st.text_input` and `st.text_area`. The current light gray color has insufficient contrast for low-vision users.

title: `st.tabs` & `st.expander` - Improve handling of frontend state/mount
author: mayagbarnes
summary: A request to improve frontend state preservation for `st.tabs` and `st.expander` when they are conditionally rendered. Currently, unmounting/remounting these components loses their internal state (e.g., selected tab).

title: DatetimeColumn formatting options
author: amanchaudhary-95
summary: Users find the default HTML5 datetime picker in `DatetimeColumn` inconvenient (no confirmation button, styling issues). They request a custom datetime picker similar to `st.date_input` for better UX and theming.

title: st.dataframe new parameter: hide_header, hide_index for column headers
author: davidsanchez222
summary: Request to add `hide_header` to `st.dataframe`. Users want to display data rows without column headers, useful for list-like views or when headers are redundant.

title: add a 12 hr format option to time_input
author: harnson
summary: Request for a 12-hour format option (AM/PM) in `st.time_input`. The current 24-hour format is hardcoded, but many users prefer 12-hour time selection.

title: Only cache IF conditional
author: BramVanroy
summary: Request for a `cache_if` parameter in caching decorators. This would allow developers to conditionally skip caching based on the function result (e.g., don't cache if the result is `None` due to an error).

title: It would be nice if we could fully customize the 3-dot Menu
author: Odrec
summary: Users want to customize the items in the top-right "3-dot" app menu. Specifically, they want to hide distracting options like "Deploy" or "Print" in production apps while keeping others like "Settings".

title: st.data_editor: allow editing mixed data types
author: Marvelss
summary: `st.data_editor` fails to allow editing when a DataFrame contains mixed data types (e.g., strings and integers in the same column). It becomes read-only despite `disabled=False`.

title: Streamlit st.video doesn't respect "Copy video at current time" Youtube URLs.
author: kajarenc
summary: `st.video` ignores the `t` (time) parameter in YouTube URLs (e.g., `?t=23`). Users expect the video to start at the specified timestamp from the URL.

title: Streamlit Data Editor: Date values that are pasted from excel is not pasted correctly
author: nicolasang333
summary: Pasting data from Excel into `st.data_editor` breaks formatting for date values or floats with commas. The editor should better handle locale-specific formats during paste operations.

title: Respect console do not track
author: allo-
summary: Streamlit should respect the `DO_NOT_TRACK` environment variable to disable telemetry, aligning with the "Console Do Not Track" standard, instead of requiring a config file change.

title: I would like to use int indices for charts, not just str or None
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: Charts raise errors when using integer column names for x/y/color parameters. Users want to be able to reference columns by integer index or name without manually renaming them to strings.

title: Right side padding for code blocks too small when scrolling
author: mayagbarnes
summary: The right-side padding in `st.code` blocks is missing when scrolling horizontally, causing text to butt up against the edge. This is a visual polish issue.

title: Color key of scatter_chart does not word wrap, nor is there any way to see all keys
author: wyattscarpenter
summary: The color legend in `st.scatter_chart` does not wrap or scroll when there are many items, causing it to extend off-screen and become unreadable. It needs better layout handling.

title: Bugs when using chat_input() with st.empty()
author: ylf-Ng
summary: Replacing an `st.chat_input` inside an `st.empty` container with another `st.chat_input` fails to render the new one correctly. This dynamic replacement used to work in older versions.

title: Values duplicated across x axis in plotly tooltip when using x unified hovermode
author: becify
summary: Plotly charts with `hovermode='x unified'` display duplicated or incorrect tooltip values for the X-axis in some cases. This seems to be a bug in how Streamlit renders Plotly's unified hover state.

title: Unnecessary failover on /_stcore/stream
author: isunli
summary: Streamlit fails to load subpages correctly when deployed behind a reverse proxy (AWS ALB), hanging on WebSocket connections (`/_stcore/stream`). The root cause seems to be related to path handling in the WebSocket URL.

title: New component: `st.drawer` as a dismissable container
author: silverOrdeal
summary: Request for a `st.drawer` component: a dismissible side panel that slides out, distinct from the sidebar. Useful for chat, details, or settings without cluttering the main UI.

title: Force Streamlit components in the bottom of the page, near chat_input
author: paolomagnani-mxm
summary: Users want to pin other components (like file uploaders) to the bottom of the page alongside `st.chat_input`. Currently, only the chat input stays fixed at the bottom.

title: Script cancellation from GUI
author: CHerSun
summary: Request for a "Stop" or "Cancel" button in the UI that can actually terminate the running Python script/thread. Currently, "Stop" only halts the frontend rendering, leaving backend tasks running.

title: Issue with user defined class identity between script reruns
author: kajarenc
summary: Custom classes defined in the app script lose their identity (class type) upon rerun, causing `isinstance` checks to fail. This is a known limitation of Streamlit's execution model but causes recurrent confusion.

title: Altair "Save as PNG" downloads a low-res blurry image
author: MaxKrog
summary: Downloading Altair charts as PNGs results in low-resolution, blurry images because Streamlit uses the default 72 PPI. Users request a way to set a higher PPI for downloads.

title: st.write_stream support for code
author: sircambridge
summary: Request for `st.write_stream` to support streaming code blocks with proper syntax highlighting and typewriter effects. Currently, streaming code results in flashing/janky rendering.

title: Group by context menu on dataframe and data_editor
author: sfc-gh-pkommini
summary: Request for a "Group By" feature in `st.dataframe` context menus. Users want to interactively group rows by column values to analyze data summaries directly in the grid.

title: AppTest doesn't work with relative filenames in st.sidebar.page_link()
author: esnible
summary: `AppTest` fails when testing `st.page_link` with relative paths, claiming the page doesn't exist. The test runner should resolve relative paths correctly.

title: `file_uploader` provides UI feedback on hover-over the upload dropzone
author: ucg8j
summary: `st.file_uploader` lacks visual feedback (highlighting) when dragging files over the drop zone. Users request a UI indication that the drag-and-drop is valid.

title: File Caching Results in Authorisation Bypass
author: mfaisaltariq
summary: Files downloaded via `st.download_button` remain cached and accessible via URL to unauthorized users. Users request a way to clear the file cache or secure the download link after use.

title: [Coming soon] support query params in st.page_link (and st.switch_page!)
author: akeeman
summary: Request to support passing query parameters in `st.page_link` and `st.switch_page`. This would allow navigation to preserve state or pass data via the URL.

title: `data` isn't required for data and chart elements: Improve`data=None` appearance or make `data` required
author: sfc-gh-dmatthews
summary: Calling charts like `st.area_chart()` without data renders a blank space instead of an empty state or error. Users expect a clearer indication when data is missing.

title: [Coming soon] Passing query parameters on switch_page
author: MaxvandenBoom
summary: Request to pass query parameters to `st.switch_page` to update the URL state during navigation. This is useful for maintaining context across page switches.

title: [AppTest] Add file_upload widget
author: H4dr1en
summary: Request to add support for `st.file_uploader` interactions in `AppTest`. Testing file upload logic is currently blocked without this feature.

title: plot size changes when using scroll-zoom with st.plotly_chart
author: noamgot
summary: Scroll-zooming in `st.plotly_chart` changes the plot size/axes incorrectly, behavior not present in standalone Plotly. This bug affects interactive data exploration.

title: Add callbacks to sidebar page navigation and `st.page_link`
author: hansthen
summary: Request for callbacks (`on_click`) in `st.page_link` and sidebar navigation. This would allow executing code (e.g., updating session state) immediately before navigating.

title: Ability to clear a `date_input`
author: hansthen
summary: Request for a "Clear" or "Reset" button in `st.date_input` to allow users to deselect a date and return to a `None` state.

title: In date_input calendar view allow marking of specific dates
author: hansthen
summary: Request to highlight specific dates in the `st.date_input` calendar (e.g., with dots or colors) to indicate data availability or events.

title: st.slider should support format_func
author: mkleinbort-ic
summary: Request to add `format_func` to `st.slider` to customize the display of values (e.g., adding units) without changing the underlying return value.

title: restart app if component doesn't load
author: iuiu34
summary: Custom components sometimes fail to load with a timeout error. Users request a way to auto-reload the app or increase the timeout to handle these intermittent failures gracefully.

title: st.skeleton() - Implementation Proposal for space-filling empties.
author: Asaurus1
summary: Proposal for `st.skeleton()`: a placeholder element that shows a loading animation while reserving space for future content. This improves perceived performance and reduces layout shift.

title: Can I enlarge the image into full screen by double clicking the image?
author: y9c
summary: Request to allow enlarging images to fullscreen by clicking on the image itself, rather than finding the small toolbar button.

title: Customizable labels to be displayed when st.column_config.LineChartColumn is being hovered
author: nidoro
summary: Request to customize the hover tooltip in `LineChartColumn` (sparklines) to show context like X-axis values instead of just the Y-value.

title: Adding '/a/a' in the end of URL address causes a blank page.
author: jnsp
summary: Appending extra slashes to the app URL (e.g., `/a/a`) causes a blank page instead of a 404. Streamlit should handle malformed URLs gracefully.

title: Selectbox returns old element not in options if format_func returns the same value for old and new options
author: TomWildenhain
summary: `st.selectbox` fails to update the selected value if the options change but the `format_func` output remains the same for the old and new values. This is a caching/keying bug.

title: add_rows() silently fails on compound altair chart
author: ehubin
summary: Calling `add_rows()` on a compound Altair chart (e.g., layered or concatenated) fails silently. It should support updating data for complex charts or raise a clear error.

title: Provide a way to configure the max-width of a resizeable sidebar
author: chrispy-snps
summary: Request to configure the maximum width of the resizable sidebar. The default max width is too narrow for some applications requiring wide control panels.

title: Improve support custom class hashing
author: kodimatrix
summary: Request to expose Streamlit's internal hashing logic for custom classes. Developers want to reuse the robust hashing mechanism for their own objects in `st.cache_data`.

title: Cannot set custom st.plotly_chart() font attributes with fig.update_layout()
author: ethanknights
summary: `st.plotly_chart` ignores font settings passed via `fig.update_layout`, using Streamlit's theme fonts instead. Users want the option to override the theme and use custom fonts.

title: Add a tree view/select element
author: CSVKRAO
summary: Request for a native Tree View widget to display hierarchical data (like file systems) with expand/collapse and selection capabilities.

title: Increase secret management's level of protection
author: fsmosca
summary: Request to encrypt secrets in Streamlit Community Cloud for higher security, rather than storing them as plain text in the dashboard.

title: Support named colors in `st.map`
author: jhgb37
summary: `st.map` raises an error when using named colors (e.g., 'red') in the color column. It expects specific formats. Users want support for standard color names.

title: Rainbow text changes colour of emoji
author: aselaws
summary: The `:rainbow[...]` Markdown color style incorrectly changes the color of emojis within the text. Emojis should retain their original colors.

title: Label for container (fieldset)
author: ghost
summary: Request for a `label` or title parameter for `st.container` (rendering as a fieldset with legend). This visually groups related widgets.

title: Display the file on screen when its uploaded with the help of st.file_uploader widget
author: anirudh-hegde
summary: Request for `st.file_uploader` to automatically display the uploaded file (image/PDF) immediately after upload, without extra code.

title: `st.data_editor` doesn’t return the input value unless you press Enter or click outside the editor
author: Wattyyy
summary: `st.data_editor` does not commit changes to session state until the user presses Enter or clicks away. Users want options to trigger updates more aggressively or on button clicks.

title: copy and paste values from excel in to st.data_editor
author: hikmetc
summary: Pasting float values with commas (e.g., "23,4") from Excel into `st.data_editor` strips the comma, changing the value (to "234"). It should respect locale or standard number parsing.

title: I would like to be able to select a language in the date_input component
author: sora32127
summary: Request to allow setting the locale/language for `st.date_input` independent of the browser's locale. This ensures consistency for all users of an app.

title: Inputs are not saved in `st.session_state` when blocking happens
author: Wattyyy
summary: If a blocking operation (like `time.sleep`) occurs after a button click, input widgets (like `st.text_area`) sometimes fail to update their session state value before the run starts.

title: `st.multiselect` returns empty on dynamically changing options.
author: PradeepReddy-epi
summary: `st.multiselect` inside a form returns an empty list on submission if the options were updated dynamically. This state synchronization issue breaks dynamic forms.

title: Make Streamlit more friendly to multi-threading
author: mayagbarnes
summary: A general request to improve multi-threading support. Using threads with Streamlit requires manual context management (`add_script_run_ctx`), which is error-prone.

title: Add configurable footer element
author: hemker
summary: Request to add a configurable footer element. Since the default footer was removed, users want a standard way to add copyright or imprint info to the bottom of the app.

title: Generic date formatting in date_input
author: hansthen
summary: `st.date_input` format parameter is restrictive. Users want support for more generic format strings (e.g., "MMDD") to match their data entry needs.

title: Enhance Streamlit's Compatibility with Playwright on Windows by Updating Event Loop Configuration
author: reasonmethis
summary: Streamlit forces the Selector event loop on Windows, which is incompatible with Playwright (requires Proactor). Users request a fix or config to allow Playwright to run.

title: Support :hex[text to be colored] for colored text in addition to having :color[text to be colored]
author: kwaksaewon
summary: Request to support hex color codes in Markdown coloring, e.g., `:hex[#FF0000][text]`. Currently, only a limited set of named colors is supported.

title: Typeahead/autocomplete (async) st.selectbox widget
author: sfc-gh-bhay
summary: Request for an async `st.selectbox` that can fetch options dynamically from a backend as the user types (server-side filtering/typeahead).

title: Expose all Streamlit Types, I.E UploadedFile from file_uploader input
author: agaddis02
summary: Request to export type definitions (like `UploadedFile`) from the top-level `streamlit` package for better type hinting and static analysis support.

title: Add a `conversion` parameter to input elements
author: hansthen
summary: Request for a `conversion` or `type` parameter in input widgets (like `st.text_input`) to automatically cast the output to a specific type (e.g., int, float).

title: Rearrangeable rows in dataframe
author: jethrorlee731
summary: Request to allow rearranging rows in `st.dataframe` via drag-and-drop. This is useful for ranking or prioritizing items in a list.

title: Add image carousel element
author: pranavnerurkar
summary: Request for an Image Carousel component to display multiple images horizontally with scrolling, saving vertical space compared to a list of images.

title: Using st.data_editor with session state, input data "disappears": Requires double input to register changes.
author: TheBoojah
summary: `st.data_editor` updates lag by one interaction when used with session state in specific patterns. Users have to enter data twice to see it register.

title: UI breaks when using brower's translate feature
author: gobaldia
summary: Browser translation features (like Google Translate) break Streamlit's UI, causing widgets to disappear or layout to break. Users want better compatibility.

title: Toasts are not preserved when page reloaded
author: arogozhnikov
summary: `st.toast` messages do not persist after a page reload or rerun triggered immediately after the toast. Users want toasts to survive the immediate next reload.

title: st.data_editor returns df with dict changed to string of dict
author: hEAkahEq
labels: type:bug, status:confirmed, priority:P4, feature:st.data_editor, status:unlikely, upstream
summary: `st.data_editor` converts dictionary values in DataFrame cells to strings, even for disabled columns. It should preserve the original object types where possible.

title: Allow different paths for storing configuration files
author: digitalghost-dev
summary: Request to allow `config.toml` and `secrets.toml` to exist in different directories or be loaded from custom paths, helping with deployment on platforms like Cloud Run.

title: Native support for AGgrid + returning selected rows
author: fplanque
